column1: good line, tight to off stump and good carry through, but not express. Cook leaves alone, as you'd expect
a hint of outswing to the left-hander, again on a good full length. Cook lets it fizz by once more
ploughing a furrow outside off, a touch wider this time, and Cook still has no desire to put bat on ball. He'll leave it all session given half a chance
outside off once more, Cook waves it through, drawing the sting on this traditionally frantic first morning
and bat on ball this time. An ironic cheer as Cook pokes forward with utter conviction, playing the ball late and firm back down the wicket
an angled prod, and how often has Cook got off the mark with that shot? Soft hands, played late, squirted through the gully. That's how he rolls
oof, that's a good line! Pitching full, nibbling back and passing over the stumps. Well left in the end
good line again, nipping away from the left-hander this time
another good leave as Hazlewood finds another fine line outside off, nip off the pitch but dying through to the keeper. There's juice in the deck but it tends not to last in this heat
another good line, another good leave. This is compelling already
forward and blocked, that's a good ball, pitching middle and leg and nipping to off. Met with a full face
forward and pushed to cover. A well negotiated over
well bowled, a very full length, targetting the base of off, and forcing Cook into a late decision. Right under the eyes and pushed back to the bowler
probing away at the off stump. No way through there
on the back foot, probably for the first time this series. And defended with great ease back down the wicket
edged and gone! Cook had no choice but to play the line, but the ball kissed the edge with a hint of outswing, and comfortably pouched by Handscomb at first slip!
on the pads, the right-hander reaping the rewards of Starc's left-handed line, and tucking an easy flick off the hip to open his account
back of a length, solidly into line on the back foot
plugging away on an off-stump line to the left hander. Stoneman defends
outside off, no stroke this time
through to the keeper, a confident stride from Stoneman to leave the ball alone
played down off the hip, Handscomb at short leg is briefly in business, but can't get close to the half, quarter-chance
blocked on the back foot. So much more time to think on back foot than front
left alone with a waft of the willow. Stoneman is looking composed. And yes, that is clearly a kiss of death, but hey, it's true!
outside off, left well alone

driven beautifully! That is James Vince at his best! Right under the nose, full and tempting, Vince strides out to meet it, clobbers it along the deck, and that is England's first boundary of the Ashes
outswinging yorker! Well played in the end as Vince jams down late and squirts a non-chance into the cordon
full again, Starc targetting the yorker, and Vince once again sizes up the drive. Comes off the toe this time, but the intent is plain
short, but leg-sided. Vince flinches, but the ball is out of harm's way. And Starc had a word at the end of his followthrough. It probably ended in 'grrr'
full again, a bit of wobble on a tight line. Vince blocks and Starc is in his ear again. Feisty!
round the wicket, given Stoneman something to think about on the angle, and chiselled up to mid-off
pumped through the covers, very full from Hazlewood and Stoneman eases it into the gap. Good positive batting
squirted through backward point, good use of the angle from Stoneman, playing on the width
forward in defence. Compact and solid
drops the hands well to let the ball fly through to the keeper
excellent from Stoneman, drawing the sting with composure
very full again, punched into the covers
outside off, and through to the keeper
outside off, through to the keeper once more with a hint of outswing
outside off, banged in a touch shorter, Vince drops his hands well and Paine - the recalled gloveman - has to bend to gather
inswing from Starc, and lots of oohs from the cordon there! Vince played it well in the end, but that was curling back in sharply by the time it reached the bat
down the leg side, that's a pleasing waft off the pads from Vince
back of a length, tight line, blocked
short but straight, Vince shapes to cut but it's too tight to the body to get it past point
on the back foot, a firm punch to cover
fully forward and blocked
a probing length, and determined defence
over the wicket, very solid line and length, and a pleasing tock of willow as Vince props forward
very full and that was utterly pinged back down the pitch by Stoneman. A beautiful connection but Starc's left boot denies him any runs
very full again, almost a full toss in fact, Stoneman flicks insouciantly across the line and connects well enough
banged in short, a nastier line but Stoneman watched it well. Not many short ones so far today. Full and fuller has been the norm today
down the leg side, a one-day wide
outside off, through to the keeper as Stoneman withdraws his bat
blocked once more, back down the pitch
banged in short outside off, left alone
that's a confident stroke! Back of a length from Cummins, and Vince strokes it sweetly into the covers. Doesn't go all the way, but used his height very well to crunch into the gap
round the wicket, met on the angle with a full face and pushed to mid-off
blocked down the ground, mid-on swoops round to gather
that's a more aggressive ball! Banged in short, and Stoneman stumbles back as he ducks, partly because the ball didn't actually get up much. Still, one for the cameras!
on the pads and that's a fine flick into space at midwicket. Good intent
driven, and that's another fine stroke from Stoneman. Not picking off the boundaries, but working the gaps with intent
punched back to the bowler, not quite to the pitch of the ball this time
forward and blocked, and nearly wriggles through the gap between bat and pad! No real alarm but the slips were excited
good inswinger from Hazlewood, well met with an inside-edged drive, and that's an angry shy in the followthrough! Aggro!
shot of the day! Overpitched, strode handsomely forward, head over the ball, crushed through the covers like a latterday Michael Vaughan! Vince is bang up for this ...
on the pads, tucked to the leg side, and into the rope! Two in two, and suddenly England are clicking up a gear as the hour mark approaches
wide outside off stump, Stoneman lets it go by
solid in defence
up on the toes, attempted punch off the back foot, inside-edged down into the crease
edged, but doesn't carry to third slip! Good soft hands from Stoneman, killing the pace
outside off, lifting through to the keeper
turned to the leg side. The Barmy Army are already finding their voice
fully forward in defence
outside off, through to the keeper
punched through the gap once again from the increasingly confident Vince
outside off, angled across the left-hander. Better carry from Hazlewood
forward and defended
banged in short, Stoneman sways. There's really nothing in this deck at the moment, as Paine gathers low once again
through to the keeper once more
fully forward and blocked back down the pitch
defended once again
through to the keeper from back of a length
on the hip, flicks down the leg side as Stoneman withdraws the bat on impact. There's no-one lurking at leg gully so no danger there
outside off, through to the keeper, but that was ever so tight to the edge. The angle kept bringing it into Vince's defence, and he just about avoids flinching
full outside off, angled across and left alone
on off stump, defended with a slightly open face and the ball runs towards gully
gets nicely forward into this full delivery and drives to mid-off
shorter in length, outside off, travels reasonably gently through to Paine
a short ball at 85mph/137kph, but comes pretty slowly off the surface and Stoneman has plenty of time to drop his hands
finishes the over with a full one outside off, left alone
short at off stump, swivels onto a pull and sends the ball behind square
short of a length on the hip, flicked down to long leg...not a million miles from the man who is now position behind square under the helmet
another good-looking drive from Vince, on the up, it wasn't a half volley, through the covers although not quite timed perfectly
huge appeal for a catch down the leg side! Aleem Dar not interested. Smith doesn't call the review. Stoneman went to flick it away. There was a noise, but came off his leg
good length at off stump, 88mph/141kph, confidently onto the front foot and finds mid-off
back of a length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
full outside off, hint of movement into Vince who drives sweetly and finds mid-off
pulls the length back, on off stump, Vince stands tall and defends at the top of the bounce
that's a bit of a tempter outside off, very full, but Vince opts to leave this one alone
back of a length, straight, tucked off the stumps into midwicket
defends a good-length delivery to the off side
gets across onto off stump and defends to the covers...tight over but well negotiated
turn straightaway! Round the wicket, pitches around middle and leg, turned significantly as it takes a leading edge to the off side
gets forward and defends
he's found the ideal spot from the off, this brings Stoneman forward to defend. Nice dip
angled in at middle stump, pushed back to the bowler
this one gripped as well, was just outside off this time, tapped towards backward point a little uncertainly
lovely stuff, takes a thickish outside edge towards the short third man area as Stoneman stretched forward. A super opening over from Lyon
a short delivery, Stoneman is through his pull shot and takes a blow on the body
angled across outside off, back of a length, left alone
a touch fuller outside off, he judges this well and shoulders arms
this is nicely worked away off the stumps, uses his wrists to tuck it through square leg
onto the back foot against a short-of-a-length delivery, punches towards mid-off
this is much fuller, at off stump, Stoneman doesn't quite get a full stride in and the bat twists a touch as he plays it back to the bowler
first ball to the right hander, full outside off, Vince defends to cover
this one turns, is a little shorter, defended on the back foot into midwicket
fuller, brings him forward, bat and pad together
worked into the leg side, a shorter delivery
tucked off the pads behind square on the leg side
round the wicket, pushes this into the pads and it's nudged into midwicket
full outside off, nudging 90mph/145kph (89.7), left alone
drives a full delivery to mid-off
full again, punched back to the bowler who shapes to hurl the ball back but keeps hold of it
bangs in a short ball at off stump and this barely reaches Paine on the full as Stoneman sways out of the line, the delivery dying through to the keeper
pushes this down the leg side, Stoneman can't catch up with it. A tumbling take for Paine
back outside off, 91mph/146kph, and it's driven back to Starc who gets low in his follow through
widish line outside, Vince gets well forward to defend
appeal for a catch at short leg! Significant turn, but it's only taken thigh pad/top of the pad
plays back and defends to the on side
again he opts to go back in the crease, flicks this towards short leg
uses his feet this time, Lyon saw him and dragged the length back a little, it turn and Vince played it a little awkwardly to the leg side
defended on the front foot, a super contest developing between Lyon and the two batsmen
short of a length at off stump, 89mph/143kph, played to cover
short outside off, he may have been tempted to square cut that but leaves it alone
full and straight, clipped off the stumps through the gap at midwicket and the three brings up both England's fifty and the fifty stand
short of a length at off stump, defended to the covers
this short ball causes a few problems, perhaps didn't quite get up as Vince expected and gets a bottom edge into into a pretty sensitive spot
a short ball angled across over off stump, Vince drops his gloves and lets it through
short outside off, he steps back and cuts into point but only for the single
worked off the stumps to short leg
a shorter delivery, spins into Vince who plays back and flicks into short leg again
this one finds a thickish inside edge but runs safely through where leg slip would have been
tosses this one full and wide outside off, Vince is drawn into the drive, a little away from his body and mistimes to cover
nice spot, full outside off, Vince gets well forward and blocks
good length outside off, defends this quite late and it runs to gully
short of a length, punched off the back foot and can't quite find the gap between cover and point
full and wide, Stoneman reaches out for a drive, didn't get his foot near the pitch, skews wide of cover
short of a length at leg stump, gets inside the line and tucks through square leg
he's missed out on this one, was short outside off, went for the cut and found point
gets too straight, but Stoneman misses his flick, takes the pad and Paine is able to cut it off
full and straight, dead-batted down the pitch
this one is outside off, defended to the leg side
tosses this one up, plenty of air, outside off with a bit of nice dip. Vince defends
drives to drive this wide of mid-off but picks out the fielder
tucked off the pads into midwicket
plays back to a shorter ball and defends. Another teasing over from Lyon
there it is, the bouncer, outside leg stump and Stoneman ducks
short again, angled onto off stump, Stoneman is back and punches to the covers
fuller, at the pads, flicked firmly into short leg
short, pushed across the left hander from around the wicket, he drops his gloves out of the line
onto the back foot to defend a short ball which comes off the pitch pretty comfortable...almost as though the ball has the life sucked out of it
banged in again, on the back foot and defended down by his feet...will Starc get one more over before lunch?
takes a thick outside edge towards backward point as Vince comes forward
short outside off, spins, defended on the back foot
well bowled, pushed across on the angled and finds the outside edge, but it goes safely towards ground wide of slip and runs to third man
defended to the off side
tickled around the corner, keeps leg slip interested
full at middle, defended back to the bowler
pounds the middle of the pitch at 88mph/141kph, through to the keeper
not too far from the gloves as this is down the leg side, Stoneman a touch late getting everything out of danger
a bouncer, plenty of time to get underneath
fuller, at the stumps, defended into the leg side
another bouncer, a little more life in this one although Stoneman is able to get down low
back of a length at off stump, a solid block into the covers
right on the money, tapped to leg
outside off, good turn and bounce, fended back down the pitch
big turn from outside off. 'Beautiful Gary' says Tim Paine. He's right... he is
tucked off the hip to backward square
fully forward, full face of the bat. Blocked
width, and a fraction back of a length. Turns and bounces as Vince punches off the back foot with hard hands. Can't quite squeeze past backward point
two slips and a short cover, but Vince has no qualms about striding onto the front foot and punching hard into the covers. An eye-pleasing stroke
round the wicket, and holds its line outside off. Stoneman flinches as it lifts past the edge. Good nut
back of a length, squeezed out to point. Probing...
that is tremendous! Overpitched, and Stoneman leans into an on-drive, just waiting for the ball to arrive under his nose, and dinking it past mid-on. Shot
outside off, good leave in the end, as this one angles in and nips away
left alone through to the keeper
leaning into the off side, more spin into the right-hander
tight lines from Gary, no liberties on offer here
well watched, defended back down the pitch
turned inside out by this one, as Lyon finds some extra purchase outside off
drilled hard, but straight back to the bowler. Lyon is turning the screw a touch in this over
lots more air outside off, tempting the big yahoo. And Vince refuses to be drawn, kneeling into a firm defensive block. Top over
round the wicket, left alone
pushed firmly, in the air for a moment, into the covers. Probing from Starc
in the right areas once again
round the wicket, banged in short, hops over the shoulder with little venom
tapped firmly off the hip, out to square leg
poked into the off side
looped up and good turn off the deck. Nothing doing for Vince
more spin, more caution from Vince, firmly onto the front dog
attempted flick to leg, can't pick the gap
pushed onto the back foot, worked to leg
here comes the big shot! Vince is bored of blocking, gallops out to meet the pitch, and slams a drive through the covers! Well played, judged the aggression just right
worked to midwicket, looking for the single, but no way through there
worked to leg with a good quick call. Good running
full length, a threat of inswing, defended back to the bowler
attempted cut, can't quite get over the shot to beat the field
crunched straighter this time. Good contact but no way through
squared up a touch in defence outside off
on the back foot, pushed hard into the covers, and that is Vince's highest Test score. He'd twice made 42 but never gone on ...
turned off the pads, a rare freebie on leg stump, and a welcome chance to rotate the strike
round the wicket, blocked to the off side
tossed up, but that's a fine leave, as Stoneman assesses the likely spin and keeps well out of harm's way
forward and punched to cover. 'Nice Gary!'
forward once again, head over the ball
outside off, no stroke offered
banged in short, cut fiercely, feet off the ground, and larruped backward of point. Shot!
pushed back, tapped into the covers
on the back foot, and all the time in the world to angle the bat and steal the single into the covers
round the wicket, left well alone
on the back foot once again, Cummins not quite getting it right in this spell
round the wicket, worked to the leg side
back of a length, angled into the stumps, punched to the off side
through to the keeper, left well alone
compact in defence on the back foot
onto the front foot, driven square, and there is Vince's first Test fifty! And what a stage on which to produce it! Tremendous attractive batting. And there's more on offer yet
wider on the crease this time, very full length, and Vince is watchful as he is squared up on the angle
back of a length and Vince slams into a cut. Timed it almost too well as it hits point before anyone can blink
on the back foot, and another impressive punch into the covers. Lots of placement over power from both batsmen. A lot of threes today... which is unusual
outside off, no stroke this time
drilled into the covers! He's oozing confidence now
outside off, through to the keeper again
on the pads, and worked to the leg side
tight line, full faced defence
fully forward and defended
lovely strike, Hazlewood hitting the right area but with no great venom, and Stoneman just leans through the line to ease the ball clean down the ground
shorter and sharper, but Stoneman plays it well, leaning inside the line as the ball zips past his visor
on the hip, back of a length, worked to square leg
tight line, wicket to wicket, met on the back foot with a vertical bat
through to the keeper. Dare one say it, Australia are starting to look in need of something special
on the pads, tucked into the leg side
no stroke offered, gentle outswing through to Paine
through to the keeper again
back of a length, Vince hops back and into line to defend
banged in short, loops through to the keeper as Vince sways
attempted yorker! But it fizzes through as a low full toss as Vince pushes with hard hands. Sounded like a thin snick too, but down into the ground
this is a top shot! Whips a full delivery off the stumps, wide of mid-on and it has the legs to prevent it being another three.
good comeback! Full outside off, brings Stoneman pushing forward and this zings past the outside the edge. Bit of movement off the seam
tucked to mid-on
gets a small stride forward into a full delivery and defends to the covers
back of a length, Stoneman meets it with a straight bat and defends to cover
neatly inside the line of a short-of-a-length delivery and tucks it out to deep square
full outside off, left alone
gets nicely forward and plays a punchy drive wide of short cover and past mid-off...brings up the century stand
short of a length, 88mph, defended
flips a back-of-a-length delivery from around off stump to square leg
this one has a bit more life on it as it carries through to Paine at chest height from a full length
goes very full at off stump, drilled straight of mid-on by it's cut off with a dive. Good support for the bowler
good length at off stump, 85mph/136kph, defended
steps forward then leaves alone outside off, cries of encouragement from keeper and slips to the bowler
flick off the pads, angled in at middle and leg, travels quickly towards fine leg but Vince is very alert to the chance of a second because Starc had to run around the ball
back at off stump, full, Vince quickly onto the front foot but finds Hazlewood
short of a length, defended on the back foot down by his feet
84mph/135kph, solidly defended to cover
a jabby defensive shot with Stoneman caught a little between playing forward and back
very full, dug out and Starc gathers as he follows through
knocked into the leg side, space at midwicket
round the wicket, full and straight, pings off the middle as Vince presses forward and cannons into Starc's boot
short-of-a-length, worked into midwicket
full at off stump, maybe a hint of tail into the batsman as he defends to cover
spins down the leg side, some bounce too, neatly taken by Paine
full at off stump, defended
inside edge flies close to short leg! Did this go to hand? Nope, went behind Bancroft as Vince played forward
that's a lovely shot, dropped a fraction short and Vince rocks back to drive through the covers
defended towards point
pushed towards mid-on
round the wicket, spears his first ball short down the leg side
left alone outside off
tucks this to mid-on from back-of-a-length
gets across the stumps and works a short delivery into the gap at midwicket, more good rotation of the strike
another of those cover drives, skims wide of the short cover in the air...wasn't too far away
an appeal for lbw but Erasmus says not out. Was there an edge? Vince playing a little across the line
touch short, picks out point with his cut
nicely bowled, slower and fuller at off stump, finds the outside edge but played with soft hands and it runs wide of slip
blocked back towards the bowler
pushed carefully off the front foot
tight line, full at off stump, the ball trickles into the leg side
on the spot, full and straight, thuds off the middle of the bat
full outside off, 88mph/141kph, left alone
onto the front foot, driven firmly into the pitch and it bounces up to short cover
that's a reasonably tight leave, back of a length, may have travelled over off stump in the end
and there's a loose drive! His first of the day, really. Came forward to drive, wasn't quite a half volley, goes through with the shot and is beaten
this one is solidly blocked, head over the ball
full, good channel just outside off, left alone
that's a ripper! Turn and bounce. Beats the outside edge as Stoneman comes forward. Mightly close to a feather
defended into point
drifts into off stump, pushed to the covers
defends a length delivery...Lyon demanding respect almost every ball
tight at off stump, patted to the off side
full at the stumps, blocked. Tight over
short of a length outside off, cut square through point to a deepish point
back of a length from round the wicket, pushed to mid-on with a straight bat
finds the edge, but it falls well short of a second slip who can't stop it cleanly and that's enough to take Stoneman to his fifty. Has passed fifty each time he's batted on the tour
a straighter delivery and as he's done very well tucks it into midwicket
a short ball which rises gently past off stump as Vince lets it go through
angled in at the stumps, neatly played, pushes with a slightly open face to find the gap towards deep point
some excitement around the bat as this straightens from round the wicket, takes Vince high on the front leg
and this one goes straight on, lovely bowling, Vince has to adjust late and is almost square on when he defends

dropped, Tim Paine has shelled one! Another super bit of bowling, pushed across and found the outside edge as Vince pushed forward. Wasn't a big deflection, although not easy standing up. It clangs out of the gloves.
padded away down the leg side
defended to cover
defended into the leg side...drama in that over
punched square off the back foot to point
good length from round the wicket, pushed into the gap at cover
full and straight, and a top-class response from Vince as he plays the perfect on-drive which whistles straight down the ground
full outside off, left alone
a short ball outside off, he arches his back to get out of the line
wide outside off, a comfortable one to leave alone
defended to cover
pushed back down the pitch
a little more air on this one, drifts in at the left hander who defends
very full, on the popping crease, Stoneman forces it into the off side without really find the gap
plays back to a shortish delivery, worked off the pads
full at off stump, tries to steer it into a gap at cover but Lyon chases across to cut it off
short of a length outside off, left alone

through him! Cummins makes the breakthrough moments before tea. A top delivery. Round the wicket, just back of a length, zips past Stoneman's inside edge into middle stump. A gem of a ball to end a very fine innings. Was that reverse swing?
gets a full, straight one first ball, defended to the off side
good length, zips through to the keeper...movement in the air, the ball is starting to reverse
well bowled, full at the stumps, Root keeps it out as he defends to mid-on
back of a length, nudged towards mid-on and he's able to scamper himself off the mark with the last ball of the session
full and threatening to swing. Good areas
on the back foot, and punched into the off side
outside off and through to the keeper
wider on the crease, attacking Root's stumps. The skipper squares up to defend
outside off, and good carry through to the keeper. Root strides across his crease to leave alone
on the back foot, blocked back down the pitch
very full, very wide, slashed down through third man. That'll do for Vince
tight to off stump, left well alone. Good judgment
on the pads, that's easy pickings for a well-set batsman. And Vince has rattled into the 80s
good delivery, full and straight, and blocked
solid line and length from over the wicket, pitching leg, defended on middle. Impeccable
on the pads, tucked to the leg side
lovely flick into the leg side, once again an England batsman favouring placement over power to work the gap in the field
banged in short, Root climbs into the pull but doesn't connect properly. Right off the toe
shoulders arms and through to the keeper
up on the toes, stabbed to cover
on the pads once more, nothing outrageous from Australia, but definitely more leaky deliveries in this brief post-tea period
firmly struck, on the front foot, and clobbered to short cover
solid in the crease, waiting in a neutral stance to block the ball under his nose
drilled into the covers, Vince has nailed his drive so well today
compact block on off stump
overpitched, and too wide to threaten the stumps. Squirted through point
beaten! That's a good nut from Starc, over the wicket, luring Root into a drive with late outswing to the right-hander. And he grins/grimaces in his followthrough
forward and blocked to cover
on the pads, worked into the leg side
through to the keeper, no stroke offered

Vince is run out for 83! A sensational pick-up-and-shy from Nathan Lyon in the covers, and he's gone by a yard! Vince knew from the moment he set off that he was up against it, but it still took a dead-eyed off-balance fling at two stumps to seal the deal!
width outside off stump, no stroke offered
swing from a full length, and chopped into the gully. Taken on the bounce for a 'crowd catch'
that's a sweet stroke, waiting for the swing and easing through the stroke. Pushed into the gap in the covers
full length, attacking off stump, Malan blocks
tapped into the off side
outside off, through to the keeper once again
very full, very straight. Root digs it out on the creaseline
on the back foot, and pushed down the wicket
down the leg side, Root wafts but no chance of making contact
sliding down the leg side
tight wicket-to-wicket line
solid block on off stump, Hazlewood plugging away
fully forward and crunched into the covers
tight line, solid defence
sliding down the leg side
on the pads, Starc strains for the inswinger but overpitches. Root takes full toll with firm contact through square leg
solid defence, pushed out to cover. A thought of a run, but quickly turned down
short, and hoisted out to the leg side. Not entirely in control but perfectly safe, behind square and short of the boundary riders
outside off, drops the hands, through to the keeper
through to the keeper
on the pads, flicked hard behind square
what's this... loops up in the air, pouched at short leg... any bat involved? Nope. On we go
Root thrusts a pad at a leg-side delivery. Not sure that strictly counted as a stroke but the umpire seems happy
sharp turn outside the left-hander's off stump. Left alone
a bit of uncertainty for Malan as he pushes through gully... a good spell here
beaten! Sharp hands from Paine to whip off the bails, but Malan's foot is anchored
pushed into the off side
a controlled pull into the leg side. Short and firmly dealt with
outside off, no stroke offered
blocked with solidity
drops the hands well outside off stump
defended back to the bowler
through to the keeper, and no stroke offered
round the wicket, this spins, takes the inside edge into the pad
well, well, the captain brings out the reverse sweep and gets a toe end to the off side
lets this slide down the leg side
back and across, has to be quick to bring the bat down as this skids on and straightens
did that go straight into short leg? Root flicked off the back foot and it scooted into Bancroft's shin guard on the full
defended coming forward
round the wicket, short of a length, defended on the back foot
full outside off, left alone
fuller at off stump, angling in at Malan, defended
low full toss which he aims to work to the leg side and gets a leading edge towards point
a lot happens here! Malan goes for a pull, the ball takes him high on the back leg. An appeal for lbw (too high) and then the ball lobs towards short leg, but no bat involved and didn't reach him
another attempted pull, gets a bottom edge towards towards Paine
leans forward on off stump and defends
spins away outside off, left alone
another one dangled outside off which Malan leaves alone
nearly pushes at this outside off, on a teasing line and length, very late to withdraw the bat
touch wider as he leaves alone
straighter, on middle and leg, worked to the on side
left alone outside off
on off stump, defended
back of a length outside off, 87mph, through to the keeper
that one came back quite a lot! Just back of a length, perhaps came back more on the angle of the delivery as Root shouldered arms
full, defended on the front foot
nicely bowled, straightens a touch off the seam from a good length as Root gets behind the line
defended down in front of the catching point
dragged down short, a rare poor ball from Lyon today, Malan plays back then threads it through backward point with a well-placed cut
back on a full length, left alone
massive spin! Pitches around off stump, turns sharply away to beat Malan's edge by a long way
and again, this time Malan holds his bat inside the line as the ball spins away
a little shorter, defended on the back foot
full outside off, left alone
very full, dug out towards backward point
this is taken on the rise by Paine as Root lets it go through...perhaps a touch more pace in the surface now?

massive moment! Huge appeal for lbw, given not out by Erasmus, and Smith has called the review. Root falling across a full delivery, trying to play it too square, the bat got caught behind his pad. This looks very good. Smashing middle!
gets the bouncer first up and takes a glancing blow on his back as he ducks
good length at off stump from round the wicket, defended to mid-on
left alone outside off
presses forward and defends
slips this down the leg side, takes a tickle wide of Paine...can't call that a chance, really!
plays this late with an open face, dabs towards the second slip...risky
fuller, left alone
this one doesn't spin, instead it slides on and Malan holds his bat inside the line...natural variation, perhaps
full and straight, sweetly flicked wide of mid-on with a nice piece of timing to get off the mark
short of a length, deflected down in front of short leg
that's a handsome shot! Malan comes out of his shell, big stride forward, and drives on the up through the covers
angles back from wide outside off, through to the keeper
slips out a low full toss which Malan misses out on as the drive picks out mid-off
a short ball, down the leg side, Malan bails out of thoughts of a pull shot
played off the back foot to mid-off
fuller, at middle and leg, defended
on off stump, straightens a little, dabbed to the off side
goodness me! Moeen has gone down on his back knee and fetched that from outside off with a slog-sweep which skims over the rope at deep midwicket. First six of the series
flicked off the pads through midwicket
left alone outside off
full, outside off, Malan opts against having a drive at this one
gets forward with bat and pad together, defended to cover
threads another drive through the off side, gets a good stride in against a full delivery. Lovely shot
and now he goes through the leg side! Whippage, fetches it from full outside off and sends it wide of mid-on with plenty of bottom hand
switches to over the wicket, full at off stump, defended
drives at another full one that's a superb, one-handed diving save by Warner at mid-off
punches off the back foot, and it's the air for a while! Doesn't reach short cover
left alone outside off
quicker, touch flatter, on the stumps and defended
slides on with the arm from round the wicket, Moeen playing off the back foot
slower, fuller, worked into the leg side
flicked off the stumps to deep square
over the wicket, on middle and leg, worked to square leg
full at off stump, defended to mid-on
brings him forward outside off and he drives to cover
full outside off, can't quite beat mid-off to his right
full outside off, left alone
huge shout for lbw, but this time Smith declines the review...Malan working to the leg side, might have pitched outside leg or was there bat? Pitched outside leg
left alone outside off
plays forward with his bat in front of pad, defends wide of gully
jeepers! Moeen misses his cut at a shorter ball, so close to getting a bottom edge. Smith thought there was one. The ball was there for the stroke
defended to the off side
full at middle, leans well forward
dragged down short outside off, this time Moeen makes contact but doesn't get any timing or placement as he finds cover
angled across outside off, good length, Malan plays inside the line
nearly gets through! A yorker, with some late shape back in at Malan. Just manages to keep the ball out with the cue end
short of a length, bit of lift through to the keeper
back of a length, left alone
fuller, gets forward and drives to cover
bang! Dropped in short and Malan is quickly on a pull, hammered it wide of square leg
defended off the stumps to the leg side
nice spot, full outside off, brings Moeen stretching forward
left alone outside off
another ripper! How good has Lyon been today? So close to an edge, again, as this spins from around middle stump and defeats Moeen as he plays forward
can leave this one alone as it spins again
touch fuller, defended on the front foot. This has been some outstandingly classy offspin today
good start, full at off stump, defended...85mph
back of a length, straightens a touch on Malan who adjusts late to play to cover
huge appeal for lbw! And Smith calls the review again. This was very full. Unless he's hit it...he hasn't hit it, but it's actually sliding past leg stump. Not even clipping, so that's a review lost
leg-sided to start his day's work, but rising into a back-foot defence on the pads
on the pads, and tucked all the way to the rope! it just dribbled over in the end, but good aggressive intent from the outset
better line from Starc, curling away from an off-stump line, well left
outside off, left alone as the ball tails towards the cordon
full length, outswing, pushed back down the pitch
angled bat, defended into the off side
back of a length, a bit too short to threaten the edge. Moeen just hangs on the back foot and waits for the ball to hit the middle of his bat
crikey, that looked for all money as though Moeen had dollied a loose drive to mid-off, but he's tonked it up and over, a couple of bounces into the rope! Well, why not... if it's up there...!
left alone this time. Circumspection to the fore
leaning into the drive, punched to cover
clobbered! Floated up outside off stump, Malan planted his front peg and wafted his cover drive clean through the line. Huge intent already from this pair
fuller length, angled into the legs, and nudged to midwicket
banged in short, Moeen drops his hands and lets the ball hop through to the keeper
onto the front foot, pushed into the off side
back of a length, defended with a hop into line
fully forward, and smothered back down the pitch
back of a length, nibbling off the pitch a bit like an offcutter. Moeen waits on his shot and deflects with soft hands to gully
up on the toes, defending on the back foot under the eyeline
seeking the back-foot cover drive, but holding his intent in check. Tapped to cover
outside off, that's a nice area, making Moeen think about whether to play or leave. He elects for the latter
squirted into the leg side
banged in short, Moeen ducks
pokey and loose from Moeen! This one sticks in the pitch outside off, and Moeen has a dart, the ball scoots in the air into the off side, just short of short cover ... close!
lose full toss, Moeen eases it into the leg side
push-driven into the covers. Starc aiming very full and at the base of the stumps
short, Moeen swings into a languid pull, and is through the stroke before it reaches him. Not having everything his own way in the last couple of overs
big stride, meeting the pitch of the ball and letting it sail by
pushed into the covers
outside off, a languid leave
round the wicket, fuller length, attacking the pads. Malan squares up to defend
full once again, resolutely blocked
another eager pull, under-edged into the leg side, but the intent is plain
round the wicket, a good leave outside off to finish the over
round the wicket first up, and blocked on a full length
outside off, no stroke offered
full length once again
ploughing a furrow outside off from round the wicket. Left once more
a firm drive, with a pleasingly perpendicular bat. But straight to cover
outside off, no stroke offered
outside off, through to the keeper. The drive is on, but England are resisting temptation

good delivery, bending back into off stump from round the wicket. But another judicious leave. England have just throttled back a touch after a rapid start this morning. Content to bide their time now
forward and solidly blocked, head over the ball
through to the keeper again
drawn forward on a middle and off line. No lateral movement in prospect whatsoever
solid line, solid length, solid block. Australia are knocking at the door, but no-one's answering
round the wicket, lifting through to the keeper and left well alone

pulled, in the air... but short of square leg! Moeen was never really in position for the shot, and just as well, because he got no power into it either. Looped up, but well short of the man. In fact, it came right off the toe
banged in short, the first bouncer of the day, but it really didn't get up
outside off once again, no stroke offered
edged down into the ground, well short of the cordon. That's the lack of pace in the deck
short, and Malan hauls his neck out of harm's way. That had a little more venom, but all things are relative. England are looking pretty serene
right on the money straight away, round the wicket, straightening off the deck, defended
blocked to the leg side, hint of turn again
Moeen leans back, lining up the cut, but lets the ball turn past unhindered
wow, that is a snorter! Flight, drift, dip, bite, and fizzes just over the top of off! Moeen played back, which was his only error!
fully forward and smothered this time, that's more like it from Moeen
tucked to leg for the fifty stand
sharp delivery, lifting into the ribs, but deflected easily enough in the end, to midwicket
on the back foot, defended with a hop
absolutely flogged off the front foot. But intercepted well at short cover
short and reasonably sharp. Malan limbos out of harm's way
through to the keeper
forward and blocked
Moeen was so lining up the slog sweep, just as well he's not a poker player! Bails out in the end...
big turn and bounce outside off, left alone
shorter and wider, big spin, waiting for Moeen to gallop down and be stumped...
left alone once again
areas, Garry. Moeen keeps his counsel in a game of cat-and-mouse
driven into the gap, that's a well-worked stroke, just leaning through the line
outside off, through to the keeper.
back of a length, and blocked down into the ground
another crashing drive, and another good intercept at short cover
round the wicket again, blocked on a good length back to the bowler
over the wicket, outside off, left alone as the ball angles across Malan's bows
more sharp spin from an off-stump line. Moeen leaves alone
this one spins less, but still too much to take out off stump. A tight leave from Moeen all the same
swept, and nailed! Clean through square leg. Bosh
up on the toes, cracked hard to point
over the wicket now from Lyon, Moeen adjusts his lines to push a defensive block to the off side
stretching forward to block on middle and leg
punch-drive to mid-off
outside off, Malan plays inside the line as the ball scoots across his bows

short, and that's well pulled, rolling the wrists on impact and gathered in the deep with a tumble by Starc, who has ripped his knee on his team-mate's spikes! Shaun Marsh was sliding in, and slashed Starc's trousers as they all but collided. Gosh, that could have been nastier than it was. Starc strides off to replace his strides...
outside off, no stroke offered, as Malan hauls his bat almost behind his back
fuller and straighter, right under the nose, and punched to mid-off
wow, that's a flashy drive! Nailed through the covers to keep England ticking along
over the wicket, spinning from outside leg, and flicked wristily through midwicket
straightens from middle and leg, blocked on the back foot to the off side
shorter, wider, oodles of time to place it through point. Malan cashes in on a rare loose one from Lyon to pick off his tenth four
another snorter! Bursts off the pitch and explodes past the stumps and the edge. Malan would do well to lay bat on that!
solidly forward this time. 'Love it, Garry, love it!' yelps Paine behind the stumps
another another beauty to finish! Dips late, spins hard, and fizzes past a tentative prod. Some absolute rippers in that over, but Malan survives, and in fact, is thriving
tight lines from Cummins
round the wicket, back of a length, tucked to the leg side with a hop
round the wicket, still charging in
turned off the hip
forward and a soft-handed block out to the off side
back and across, Moeen seeks a flick to the leg side, but can't time it
round the wicket and defended
opens the face and taps to point
leaning forward to block
nudged to the off side
keeping it watchful
swept impressively, off the pads and behind square, to bring up an excellent and hard-worked half-century
round the wicket, a short ball, Malan pulls and misses...not far from the glove
short of a length, he's back in the crease and nudges towards boot hill
short again, this time Malan connects cleanly with his pull, rolled his wrists over the ball, and finds long leg
tucked off the pads wide of short leg
hops back in the crease as Starc stays short-of-a-length, works this off his hip to leg gully
he's hammered that into short leg! Struck the pull very sweetly, clatters into Bancroft's shoulder, via the grille of the helmet. Malan checks he's okay. Shrugs it off
short outside off, Moeen will feel he misses out as he rocks back and cracks it to cover
floated up on off stump, defended
nice use of the crease, goes deep and then drives off the back foot but finds short cover again
left alone outside off
drifts into middle, worked to short leg
pushed off the back foot to cover...that's 100 overs up for Australia's attack
stays round the wicket, a short delivery, Malan gets over the top if it and pulls to deep square leg
come over to my side...short, angled across outside off, Moeen fetches it towards mid-on but can't beat the fielder
bunts this off his hip, slightly uppish, but lands safely short of deep square leg
short, wide down the leg side, lets it go through
short again, 88mph/141kph, and that's a brilliant pull from Malan, completely in control, gets over the ball, rolls his wrists, and sends it wide of deep square. Super placement
the line is outside leg this time, another pull but finds leg gully
this nearly goes wrong for Moeen, aiming a slog sweep and gets a toe end which loops in the air towards cover
in control this time, plays back to a short ball, pushes to cover
fuller, on middle and off, defended on the front foot
was this in the air to short leg? Moeen flicked it with strong wrists, couldn't get it to ground, hands on heads for the Australians. Not sure it carried. Very tough either way
nudged off the pads behind square
defended past silly point who had just been brought in
a flamboyant whippish pull from Moeen, off one leg, to deep square
and there's the breakthrough! The short ball brings the moment Australia needed. Couldn't get over this pull, takes the top edge and offers a simple catch to Marsh at deep square
the batsmen crossed, Moeen pulls this short ball along the ground to mid-on
another bouncer, over leg stump, Moeen ducks...the crowd have come alive with that wicket
manages to roll his wrists to keep this delivery down, pulled to deep square
over the wicket, a bouncer, Bairstow ducks his first ball
pushed down the leg side
short outside off, Moeen rocks back and drives wide of the short cover, the deeper man does the tidying up

double breakthrough! Moeen is given lbw. He's called for the review but this looks pretty good. Pitches around middle, straightens a fraction. Hits him low on the front pad. No bat involved. It's hitting the top of middle! (Umpire's call, so review retained)
round the wicket, another appeal as this spins in at Woakes but easily missing leg
on middle, defended
whipped with bottom hand just wide of Lyon in his follow through...not sure it reached him on the full for a chance
goes for the yorker, not far off! Bairstow keeps it out with the toe end...Australia sense a chance to keep England under 300
good length at middle and off, defended to cover
a short ball, quite a loopy one, and it's so short it's called wide
back of a length outside off, played to mid-off
tight line, on middle and off, no width for Bairstow as he defends back to Starc
a wide yorker, dug out towards point
a good bouncer, 84mph/135kph, JB keeps his eyes on the ball as he says out of the line

it's a collapse now! Lovely bowling, but a poor shot from Woakes. Driving against the spin. Tossed up outside off from round the wicket, Woakes tries to go through covers, the ball turns back to hit off stump
full at off stump, jabbed to the covers
gets forward, blocks
gets a bigger stride in and drives firmly square of the wicket
another beauty! Squares up Broad, takes the back leg towards the slips
thrusts his pad forward and it deflects towards slip, cries all round the bat
a very short bouncer over leg stump, loops through to Paine...a loosener
over the wicket now, defended to mid-on
short of a length outside off, he's off the mark from his 10th delivery with a push to the covers
back round the wicket, a predictable bouncer, Broad gets underneath it
another short ball, doesn't quite up as much and isn't too far from Broad's helmet as he ducks
takes a blow! Back over the wicket, short on middle and leg, hammers into Broad's chest. A very odd stance from Broad, a big crouch as the bowler deliveries
big spin! Rips down the leg side and misses everything, flies fine of Warner of leg slip
plays back and defends
tucked off the pads to backward square leg
goes down early and plays a deft paddle sweep, think he got this on the full, sends it to fine leg
defended off the stumps
a little shorter, defended from the crease
full at off stump, defended coming forward
very neat shot, whipped off the stumps through midwicket, Marsh gets across from deep square
width outside off and Bairstow latches on, leans back and cuts it strongly wide of gully
he played this well, got cramped for room as he aimed to play through gully again. Nipped back from short-of-a-length. Kept it down
a bouncer over leg stump
a short ball, he's through his shot way to early and the ball dribbles off a thick bottom edge to midwicket
full at the stumps, pushed into midwicket and that's a single that suits England well
pushed across outside off, a little short, cut to point
leans forward and pushes into the covers
strides forward then leaves alone outside off
angled into leg stump, pushed down the on side of the pitch
a very nice drive from Broad, big stride forward and eases a full delivery through the covers
nearly through him! Driving at a full delivery, gets an inside edge into his back leg then ball flies wide of off stump
a half-hearted appeal for lbw as a back-of-a-length delivery nips back, takes Bairstow high on the pad...angling down leg as well
reward for Cummins! Tries to take him on, goes for the pull against a short delivery, gets a top edge which flies straight up in the air just behind square and Paine trots around for a simple catch
short on leg stump, Broad back in the crease and defends with a little hop
a beauty which skims past the outside edge, short of a length and pushed across Broad who is caught in the crease
short, down the leg side, that one doesn't pose much danger...a few words between Broad and Cummins
edged! But short and wide of slip and has enough momentum to reach third man. Nicely bowled, pushed across Ball who pushed forward
pitches outside leg and spins past the pads
goes back to a slightly shorter ball, exposes his stumps, drives to cover
take that! Ball brings out an impressive sweep, connects very sweetly wide of deep square
and another! Lyon switches to over the wicket, drops it a touch short outside off, Ball elegantly rocks back and cracks it square through point
nearly through him this time! Driving against the spin, giving himself a little room, gets a thick inside half of the bat which dribbles towards mid-on
round the wicket, the bouncer at 84mph/135kph, Ball ducks
somehow he finds the gap! A well-directed short ball, Ball fends it away fine of gully...just one slip in place with the leg-side catchers
over the wicket, 87mph/140kph, short outside leg stump
back of a length, at off stump, Broad is behind the line of this one and defends towards gully
slides off the back into backward point as he plays from the back foot
has a little flap at this outside leg stump but no touch on its way to Paine
round the wicket, short on leg stump, manages to keep this down just in front of short leg
hops inside the line of a short-of-a-length ball and clips it in the air behind square
round the wicket, short outside off, left alone
great catch! Warner at leg gully with a screamer. Ball went to flick a short ball off his hip and Warner flew to his right to snaffle it
short, down the leg side, shuffles across his crease and has a bit of a waft at it
short over leg stump again, Anderson avoids it
short outside leg stump, flicks this in the air for quite a long way but doesn't carry to long leg
a short ball at the chest, Anderson fends it round the corner short of a very vocal Warner at leg slip
deep in the crease, blocked down in front of short leg...not sure Anderson will get many in his half of the pitch
big swing! Anderson steps to the leg side and has a heave across the line of a short ball, the top edge flying over the keeper. I'm sure Warner will have a few thoughts on that
short of a length, angled across and it climbs past the outside edge as Anderson spars at it
takes this on the arm, short around leg stump, fended down behind square
good bouncer, Broad has to hurry to get underneath it

dropped, and it's four! Marsh at deep square leg. Broad went after the short ball, got a big top edge, Marsh had a long time to get underneath it but it bursts through his hands, hits him on the baggy green then trickles into the rope
slips down the leg side
smacked through the leg side, pulled from outside off through midwicket...Broad isn't blocking
300 up for England...Broad pulling again, gets it between deep square leg and deep midwicket. Bonus runs. Broad punches his bat
that's short and sharp, flies over Broad's back
short of a length, down the leg side, Anderson can't catch up with it
short of a length at the body, neatly played as he works it around the corner down to long leg
swing and a miss at a short ball down the leg side...worth a full one outside off? Try and get a nick
this time it's taken. Handscomb this time at deep square. A top edged pull, doesn't have the distance this time, nealty pouched
outside off, left alone with caution
hops across the crease to let a gentle outswinger fly by
fully into line, and defended back down the pitch. Better ball from Anderson, tight and threatening
angled defence, down through third man, and Cameron Bancroft has his first runs in Test cricket!
tucked into the leg side
threre's the inswinger, but it starts on the wrong line and Bancroft clips it through backward square. A confident start to his Test career
solidly into line to block back down the pitch
excellent carry through to Bairstow as Broad aims full and just outside off. The pitch looks a touch quicker today
tapped with confidence off the pads, a good grab at short midwicket to cut off the runs
vertical bat, mobile feet, watchfully steering the ball down to mid-on
full length, full face, patted back to the bowler, Broad shapes to shy, but he's deep in his crease
well bowled... beaten outside off as this one holds its line
good delivery to greet him, full length outside off. Blocked
tucked off the hip into the leg side
big inducker, strikes the pad but too high to be a threat
through to the keeper once more
pushed through to the keeper
left alone outside off. Bancroft turns down Anderson's advances
round the wicket, Warner taps and runs, a sharp single to mid-off, but a good tight line, back of a length, from Broad
angled into the right-hander's pads, Bancroft plays into the leg-side, gathered at mid-on
on the back foot, nudged out to deep midwicket. Good manipulation of the gaps by this pair.
edged and gone! Broad strikes early, extra lift in the channel outside off, Bancroft is lured into a poke and Bairstow gathers low to his right!
outside off, round the wicket, no stroke offered as Khawaja lines it up
on the back foot, defended with a hop. We've got a game on here!
flipped out to deep midwicket, up on the points of his toes to work Anderson off middle and off
my goodness, that's a tough ball to play, angled across the left-hander, bouncing and straightening and just missing the edge. This wicket is definitely quicker now
full length again, blocked
through to the keeper once more
beaten once again, extra nip through to the keeper once again. Khawaja just about manages not to play at that one
tighter to the stumps, blocked tentatively on the back foot
through to the keeper
on the pads, worked to the leg side
edged once again! It flies away for four through third slip, but that was never in control. Broad causing problems
round the wicket, fuller and straighter. Defended on the walk
very full once again, defended back down the pitch
through to the keeper once again. Tight and threatening
tapped into the gap
there he goes! Khawaja isn't one to be cowed for long, a touch of width and he's battered this along the ground through backward point
outside off, through to the keeper
curling onto a good length outside off, and blocked
tight line, left alone outside off
back of a length and an attempted pull. Looked good, but lacked impact
a touch too short, short-arm-pulled round the corner, a good take by Bairstow as the shy comes in from the deep
crikey, that looked close, and he must have nicked it, because Broad barely appealed! Pushed right back into the crease, pinned to the crease, it would have been stone dead!
stabbed back down the track, on the front foot with pre-determined intent. Broad half-gathers in his followthrough
on the back foot, tapped to cover, another single as he pierces the gap
squirted off the hip, out through square leg. Good contact
dangle-batted defence outside off stump
tossed up full and wide, Warner spanks a drive into the covers
no messing, Warner immediately onto the front foot and driving fiercely through the covers. Slightly overpitched, freeing the arms. Shot
driven again, a low full toss by the time Warner had stretched to reach it. Short cover gathers
there we go, there's the snorter! That was what Lyon was doing all morning. Outside off, turning sharply, beating the edge
dancing at the crease, punched to point
fully squared up and defended to mid-on. A cut-and-thrust start!
full and wide of off stump, pushed to cover
full and straight, defended again
outside off, good carry through to the keeper
back of a length, pulled hard round the corner to deep backward square leg
leg-stump line, very full length, blocked back to the bowler
cracked out through the off side
flicked to the leg side
outside off, significant turn and bounce, and beaten outside off
huge appeal, and that's out! Fired in much straighter and fuller, pinned on the front pad, and Khawaja doesn't even think about a review as Aleem Dar's finger goes straight up!
back of a length, Smith steps back to flick to leg
tucked off the toes through square leg and he's off the mark
round the wicket, punched off the back foot. That's the end of a very successful over
full and straight, clipped sweetly straight of mid-on. Strong wrists from Smith, but too full from Woakes
better length, hits the pitch hard around off stump, defended
short outside off, left alone
fuller outside off, left alone
tighter to off stump, hint of shape back as Smith shoulders arms
gets right across his crease and defends a back-of-a-length delivery
tossed up at off stump, driven firmly to cover
opens himself up slightly, drives inside out to one of the two short-cover catchers
full at off stump, pushed to mid-on
angled into middle and off, gets well forward and defends
defended into the covers
pushes back down the pitch
in the channel outside off, left alone
full outside off, through to the keeper
full and straight, punched firmly to mid-on with a walking stroke
nearly works a straight delivery through midwicket
goes deep in the crease and tucks a delivery from around off stump behind square on the leg side
full at middle and off, good spot to Warner, defended back to the bowler
over the wicket, full outside off, Smith thrusts forward
flicked off the stumps to midwicket
touch slower outside off, Smith leans forward with bat well in front of pad
plays back to a reasonably full ball, defends with a straight bat
rides the bounce well, makes sure he gets this to ground wide of leg slip
stretches forward and pushes square through the off side
full outside off, driven to the right of mid-off
full outside off, left alone
same spot, outside off, so far Smith happy to leave them alone
a shorter ball, Smith across the crease and comfortably defends
angles in from back of a length, touch too short ideally, Smith easily behind it
fuller, but wide of the stumps, left alone
very full at middle and leg, clipped into midwicket
uses his feet, gets down to the pitch, clips this towards mid-on who is deep enough to allow a single
that's the first really poor ball, dragged down very short, Smith doesn't quite get his timing as he pulls through midwicket
full and straight, an open-stance drive towards mid-off...like mid-on deep enough for the run
outside off, pushed to the covers
goes back and nudges a length delivery into short leg on the bounce
round the wicket, full outside off, pushed to the covers
driven on the move to mid-off...he's overstepped
a punchy drive with an open face to the right of mid-off
strongly forward and drives to mid-off
drags the length back, outside off, Smith defends with a slightly open face
86mph, a bit of nip, comes back at Smith from short-of-a-length...left alone
full outside off, gets forward and defends
length angled in to off stump, Warner gets well forward
fuller at middle, worked into the leg side
even fuller, clipped off his toes and finds midwicket again
just a hint of width and that's a lovely late cut, gets it fine of short third man
nudged off the pads into square leg
wonderful use of the feet from Smith, skips down on the line of middle and off, whips it along the ground through midwicket. Considered an all-run four but stayed at three
full outside off, 89mph/143kph, left alone
dragged down short outside off, pulled out to deep square leg
round the wicket, back of a length, smart batting as he opens the face and places into point

that's huge! Ball has got a key wicket. Short of a length, angled in at Warner who tries to pull through the leg side, can't keep the ball down and he finds Malan at short midwicket - taken with a bit of a juggle, relief on Malan's face
what a lovely start, punches a short-of-a-length ball outside off through point
back of a length, tucked into the leg side
length outside off, 83mph/133kph, left alone
short of a length, punched off the back foot to cover
hangs it outside off, wonder if this will be tactic, left alone
left alone outside off, may have grazed the pad as it went through to the keeper
makes him play, a little fuller, Smith gets forward
he's well across his crease then works a length ball with a closed face to the leg side. Anderson returns with a maiden
a length delivery angled into the stumps, defended to midwicket
nicely bowled, quite a full length to be playing back to, takes a thickish outside edge towards gully
full and straight, defended
driven to mid-on
width outside off, gets a bottom edge which bobbles behind him to the keeper
full and straight, defended on the front foot
back of a length outside off, 86mph/138kph, defended
a fraction fuller, Smith plays slightly across the line but it's something he generally does pretty safely
into the pads but Smith can't find a gap in a tightly-packed leg-side field
angled into leg stump, Smith gets a little off-balance and it deflects off the pad towards leg slip
full at off stump, 81mph/130kph, played back to the bowler
whips across a full, straight delivery, takes it off the stumps towards fine leg where there's a bit of a fumble by Ball but doesn't cost an extra run
back of a length outside off, hits the splice hard as Handscomb defends to backward point
fuller outside off, he comes forward, plays with soft hands and it runs along the ground wide of third slip
straighter, full at middle, defended towards mid-off where Broad makes a sprawling stop
poor ball, short and wide, Handscomb square cuts in front of point...the ball slows up as it reaches the rope and it gets flicked by Vince but they can run four
onto the back foot this time and times a punchy back-foot time nicely through the covers...Handscomb has brought intent to the innings
a bouncer, travels over Smith's back
on the pads, tucked to the leg side
outside off this time, blotted out to point
deep in the crease, and blocked back to the bowler
tight line outside off, nothing spectacular. Anderson goes a touch wider on the crease but the same defensive result

huge appeal! Handscomb is so far back in his crease as Anderson fires in the yorker. Was that missing leg? England don't think so and review! There's no inside-edge ... this could be a critical moment of the Test. And it is smashing leg stump!
jeepers, that's a good welcome to the crease, a touch of movement outside off stump, and Marsh does well not to be drawn in. A fine over
on the back foot, defended
coming down the wicket with aggressive intent
good bowling! This one slides straight on, and Smith is playing for the turn. Nearly grazes the edge
solid stride forward to block
flicked out to midwicket, a good stretching stop
tight lines, blocked to the leg side. Moeen does well to prevent Smith stealing the single. So, Marsh v Anderson it is
back of a length, outside off, dabbed to point
outside off, curling away from the left-hander. Left alone
crunched through the covers, that's a lovely strike. Waited for the ball to arrive and didn't over-hit it
outside off, through to the keeper once more. Anderson bending the ball from leg to off
looping late outswinger, patted to the off side
well bowled again, on the spot outside off, nipping and bouncing and beating the edge
there's the single, clipped to midwicket. Now then...
slower and loopier through the air, round the wicket, left alone
fuller length, tighter to off stump. Blocked
leaning onto the front foot
tossed up, tempting Marsh with extra flight. A silly mid-off joins the party
forward and squeezed through the gully
full and straight, tucked to short midwicket
attacking, aggressive line from Anderson, targetting the stumps, but every ball subtlely different. This one nips back into the pads
wider on the crease, Smith plays with a closed bat-face to defend
worked from middle and leg to short midwicket
flicked to the leg side once again. Time to swing it the other way now?
attempts the variation, but it comes out as a full toss. Clipped hard but straight to midwicket. A let off
leaning forward to defend
angled block
slow and loopy like a hand grenade. Defended to cover
on the pads, Root crowding the bat on the off side
stands tall on the back foot to defend
flicked to mid-on. Another maiden
on the hip, clipped to square leg
beaten outside off. Another fine delivery from Anderson, just probing relentless on and around off stump
banged in short, no stroke offered
tapped round the corner to backward square
forward and blocked to mid-off
case in point, another ball attacking the top of off, but this one loops down the pitch, almost gathering pace from back of a length. Marsh has to be on his mettle to block it out
crunched on the up to point, a smart sliding stop from Vince
wider of off stump, left alone this time
outside off and through to the keeper
ploughing away outside off and through to the keeper again
fuller length, wider line, Smith shapes to drive and lets it go
tucked off the hip for another single
a big stride down to meet the ball, drilled down to long-on
driven into the off side, there's an incredibly silly silly mid-off, a completely ludicrous mid-off, in fact, who intercepts
ploughing away
Marsh is watchful as Moeen targets his off stump
tapped to the off side
big stride forward to block once more
outside off, Broad ploughing away on a fourth-stump line, making Smith come to meet him if he wants any runs
banged in short, Smith ducks
fuller length, demanding a stroke. Dead-batted out to the off side
Broad rolls his fingers on this one, through to the keeper
short, and a bit wide. Smith isn't interested in that one
defended once again
ooh, hello, Marsh is bored of being stuck to his crease, and tries to advance into a drive. Not this time ...
advancing again, this time for a clip to leg
worked with an open face through gully
solidly blocked
there's the loose drive! Marsh advances  but doesn't connect properly ... the ball skews out to gully
banged out on a good length, wide of off stump
squirted into the off side, on the back foot, covering the stumps
well played. Steps across the crease as Broad comes too straight. Speared gloriously through mid-on
pulled across the crease to defend to the leg side
wider outside off stump, no stroke this time
left alone once again
width outside off stump, chopped through point
fully forward, ludicrous mid-off gathers in one hand
defended to the off side
blocked to cover
clipped on the up to mid-on, looking for the single, but it's not there
shorter and wider, and that's good patience from Marsh, waiting for the bad ball and cutting firmly to the edge of the rope. A good diving stop to save the four

and there's review straightaway as Marsh pads up to Broad who is round the wicket. Not sure it's done quite enough. It's hit the back leg, doesn't matter where it's hit of course, and it's missing off stump so England lose that one. Not Root's best
outside off, left alone
defended from off stump into midwicket
full, pushed down the leg side, Marsh can't catch up with it
gets forward and pushes up to mid-off
back of a length outside off, comes back with the angle, through to the keeper
edged! But dies in front of slip. Pushing forward at a reasonably wide delivery which didn't spin
shorter, onto the back foot and pushes into midwicket
another edge! Between first and second slip, didn't quite reach them on the full, lovely bowling which drew Marsh forward and prodding for it
defended
on off stump, pushed back down the pitch
full at the pads, clipped firmly to midwicket
full at off stump, delivered from quite wide, clipped firmly to mid-on
onto the front foot, pushed to mid-off
top edge, but he gets away with it! Certainly wasn't in control. Woakes went short, Smith pulled and it went a long way in the air off the top edge but bisected deep square and long leg
slips onto the pads and that's clipped away wide of leg slip, back-to-back boundaries for the captain
pushed off the back foot into the off side
full outside off, comes forward to drive and loses his shape a touch. The ball dribbles to the leg side
flicked with a bit of a flourish from outside off to midwicket
pushes his bat in front of his pad as he defends
shorter, allows him to go onto the back foot and play to mid-on
there's an appeal for lbw here as Marsh uses his feet, Bairstow thinks it was pad first. Will need to see a replay
uses his feet again, clips this just wide of short midwicket
touch short again, whipped off the back foot wide of mid-on
pushed into the pads, worked off the hip to deep square
pushed across outside off, left alone
gets forward on off stump, defended to cover
that's very nicely played, just a hint of width, he leans back and square drives it wide of point
tightens the line, back of a length just outside off, left alone
he's not interested in this one outside off...this pair have just settled Australia
hint of turn from outside off, defended off the splice
tries to use his feet, gets a little stuck and is almost in a tangle as he nudges towards midwicket
leans forward on off stump and defends
back and across, deep in the crease, defended
stretches forward this time
slightly wider line, Smith reaches out from the crease with his bat and pad together
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, left alone
gets across and defends to cover
this rises over off stump as it's left alone
and again, some decent carry for Woakes with a 44-over old ball
a fraction fuller, defended to the covers
angled in at off stump, played with a closed face into midwicket...14 runs off the first two overs of the spell for Woakes but that was a maiden
full and straight, defended into midwicket
bit of bounce there, from a shortish length outside off, turns back and Smith has to adjust at the last minute
this fuller, he goes for the drive and it scoots off the edge, along the ground wide of slip
goes back in the crease and turns this to short leg
that's a loose ball, low full toss outside off, Smith doesn't miss out and drives it through the covers
flatter, clipped into the leg side
full at middle, defended into midwicket
strong pull shot, well over the ball this time, sends it behind square
super shot...dropped short outside off, has a lot of time to play this, pulled handsomely through midwicket
short of a length, nudged with a straight(ish) bat into midwicket and that's fifty stand...just what Australia needed
short outside off, Smith defends on the back foot
fuller, worked from around off stump behind square on the leg side...takes Smith to 49
round the wicket, pushed across onto off stump, slides off the face into backward point and takes Smith to a very hard-earned fifty
excellent batting, things starting to move for Australia, Marsh uses his feet, makes it into a low full toss and clips through midwicket
back on a good length, defended
another low full toss, picks out midwicket this time
defended to cover
pushed firmly to short cover
very full, very wide, left alone
back of a length outside off, punched off the back foot to the left of mid-off...was probably a single there
a bit of extra lift around off stump, just back of a length, takes the top of the bat as Smith defends
fuller, Smith right across his crease, ends up outside off as he pushes to cover
short outside off, left alone
short outside off, Smith doesn't take full advantage as he cuts in front of square
round the wicket, full at off stump, driven to cover
more quick footwork as he comes down the pitch then finds cover with his drive
out of his crease again then clips to mid-on
wider outside off, left alone
on off stump, tapped to the off side
shoved wide outside off, left alone
lovely placement, short outside off, punched through the covers from the back foot
round the wicket, short of a length, left alone
gets across onto off stump and defends with an open face to point...decent pace at 87mph/140kph
back of a length, this time gully runs around to do the fielding
nicely bowled, squares up Marsh a little on the back foot as he defends and the ball runs towards gully
goes full and straight, clipped off middle stump to deep square
top shot! Glorious from Marsh as he skips down the pitch and drills a drive through the covers
pulls the length back a little, Marsh stays in his crease and defends
leans forward and defends
fraction short, cut to point where Crane, the sub, backs up the bowler very well with a diving save
back on off stump, blocked
uses his feet then pushes to mid-on
length outside off, left alone
shuffles across and defends to midwicket
a firm drive which Ball gets a hand on in his follow through, deflects it towards the non-striker's stumps...it scoots past them. Think Marsh was safely back
good work at mid-off, Broad brings out the full-length dive to back-up his fellow quick as Smith leaps onto the front foot and drives
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended to mid-on
oh, that's a gem! Marsh leans forward and punches a perfect on-drive straight of Broad
back of a length and that smacks into Smith's box
good length outside off, defended
full and straight, clipped to midwicket
good length outside off, Smith across and defending...can Anderson find any reverse? Was about this stage it started going for Cummins
off the back foot through the covers, right onto his toes, and the time is perfect as it beats Stoneman's chance...the captain is looking very good (as so often)
gets this a little fuller, defended to mid-off
full, wide outside off, left alone
back of a length, through to the keeper
short, wide outside off, nice placement from Marsh as he puts it through point, not quite enough legs to reach the rope
was that a hint of movement in? Clipped from off stump wide of mid-on
a lovely-looking front foot drive but he finds cover
a short ball outside off, Marsh lets it go
back of a length outside off, driven into the covers
fuller, defended to mid-off
full at off stump, he drills his on-drive but mid-on is straight enough to cut it off
finds the gap between cover and mid-off, punched off the back foot
full and straight, clipped sweetly but finds the man at square leg
that's a beauty! Beats the edge, been a while since we've seen that. Was back of a length, straighten enough to square him up
full, wide outside off, slapped to short cover
shorter, onto the back foot and finds the deeper cover man
gets onto the front foot and blocks
left alone outside off
that's a gem! Extra bounce from a good length as it climbs past Marsh's outside edge
and this one slides on with the arm, played off the back foot wide enough of cover for the single
good length at off stump, defended
gets forward and the ball runs off a slightly open face towards gully
full at middle and off, 83mph/133kph, defended
very full, Marsh reaches for it and the bottom hand comes off the bat as it skews to the leg side
gets this full delivery wide of cover into the point area
back of a length at off stump, tucked to midwicket
round the wicket, defended
blocked
a shorter ball, goes for the cut and a thick top edge flies well over slip down to third man
goes back and defends
worked off the pads into midwicket
leans forward and defends to cover
length outside off, left alone
fuller, he's quickly forward and drives but it's intercepted at cover
left alone outside off
steers into the off side with an open face, finds the gap
round the wicket, full outside off, an elegant drive into the covers
short of a length, onto the back foot as he defends into the leg side
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended into midwicket
leans forward into a good-length ball and defends to mid-off
extra bounce from a full length, Marsh whips his bottom hand off the bat
defended into the covers
pushes a full ball up to mid-off
drags the length back, outside off, left well alone
full outside off, forward with bat and pad together
defends into the leg side
well across outside off, doesn't get that far forward even though it's a fairly full delivery
on off stump, played to mid-on
plays slightly across a straight delivery, safely into the leg side
he plays this as though it kept a little low but he was a long way back in the crease
full and straight, Broad fields and throws it miles wide of the stumps to give Bairstow some extra work
good length at off stump, defended
full, at off stump, blocked back down the pitch
a bouncer, over leg stump, he ducks
goes for the yorker! On target and well kept out by Marsh
not his best ball to end with, pushed down the leg side
outside off, back of a length, a firm punch on the up into the covers. A good confident start from Smith
wide line, back of a length again, tapped off the back foot to the man at short cover
angled into the right-hander, passes closer to the off stump but comfortably left
stabbed out to the off side, still anchored on the back foot.
still favouring a back-of-a-length approach, Smith slides into line to guide the ball to mid-on
better length from Anderson, tailing into the stumps from a fuller length, Smith squares up to block back down the pitch
round the wicket, Marsh attempts a nudge off the pads but can't make proper contact
angled down the leg side once again, this time it passes through to Bairstow
