better line and length, attacking the stumps from round the wicket,  met with an exaggerated block back down the pitch
that's too short, and too wide. Marsh hardly has to do anything but lay bat on ball outside off, and cut it firmly backward of point
solidly onto the front foot, dragged down to meet the pitch of the ball
a yawning leave outside off stump to finish the over
outside off, back of a length, Anderson hasn't quite got his length right this morning. Punched firmly to the cover sweeper
drawn forward, better line and length
round the wicket, that's more threatening. Full length, and nibbling off the seam. Defended on the crease
much fuller, from round the wicket, drawing the batsmen forward
another one in the slot from Anderson, speared in to Marsh's toes

driven again, that's not quite made it to the boundary, but he does slot it through point to pick up a comeback 50. Very well played, he had to graft at times but this is developing into a vital knock
round the wicket from Broad as well, full length and punched back down the pitch, off the front foot
well bowled again, nibbling a touch from a full length, but comfortably smothered on the front foot
blocked on the front foot. Solid from Broad and Marsh alike
probing a touch this time, not quite there for the drive, and inside-edged as the bat swishes through
on the toes, chiselled to wide mid-on
driven without conviction, Broad gathers in his followthrough
dangling the carrot outside off, Smith doesn't take the bait
driven without power back down the pitch, Anderson flicks a fingertip as the ball deflects into the stumps, but Marsh is safe
held back through the air, almost like a spinner, tucked to leg. Anderson has all sorts of tricks
full length, outside off, through to the keeper
ooh, swishy swishy! The first genuinely false stroke from Smith, an over-eager waft outside off as Anderson finds some extra bounce. No edge, but a definite near-miss
more circumspect this time, onto the front foot and blocked
very full, attacking the toes of the left-handed Marsh from over the wicket this time

oh my goodness, what a floppy way to give it away! Broad rolled his fingers and suckered Marsh into the drive, but the ball never reached him and instead looped futilely to Anderson at mid-off! What a moment. Marsh departs crestfallen. He'd done the hard work this morning, but was comprehensively undone by that one
on the hip, flicked into the leg side
hello hello ... Broad is making things happen all of a sudden, a fat outside edge from a full length. Not a catch, but squirts into the gully invitingly all the same
solid this time from Paine, fully forward to block
on the hip, tucked to leg. England have their breakthrough after 25 minutes
banged in short, no stroke offered
another bouncer, Smith wants nothing to do with it
very full, defended to the leg side
very full and punched up to mid-on
hoisted out through backward square leg
through to the keeper once more
leg-sided to begin his spell, tucked behind square
full and straight, Paine tries to work the gap through midwicket
good line and length, and good carry through to Bairstow, at 84mph
outside off, a hint of movement, or it may just have been a stray moth. Blocked either way
full and straight once more, head over the ball, defended stoutly
worked to the leg side
short, and ... err... very short. You'd need a stepladder to reach that one
a better length for the bouncer, but that's two for the over
oof, that one really takes Smith by surprise! Leaping bounce from a fuller length and that takes the splice and could have gone anywhere! Falls short of the cordon, but a rare false stroke
tip and run, takes the single to take a moment to collect his thoughts. Good batting
back of a length, and Paine spanks that firmly through backward point. Top shot
tapped into the off side
fuller length, eased onto the leg side
another short ball, and uneasily pulled out towards the three fielders set back on the leg side
a swivel pull from just back of a length, gathered in the deep
banged in short, ducked
short and swerving into the body, Smith limboes out of harm's way
on the back foot, Smith slides into line to work to leg
a slow bouncer, Smith leans into a languid pull, rolling the wrists to settle for the single
banged in short, that's a good line for the bouncer, angling in and demanding respect. Smith hops into line on the back foot
attacking the splice once more, poked into the off side
ooh, a bit swishy again, as Smith attempts a flashy steer over the slips and can't quite make contact
another one banged in short
good energy from Ball, as another delivery flies over Smith's lughole
tapped to the off side. A fine holding role from ball, as the new ball inches ever nearer
fuller length from Woakes, Paine drives straight to Moeen at short cover
through to the keeper again
back of a length, and swivel-pulled out through midwicket
short this time, and through to the keeper as Smith avoids having a swing
banged in short once more. Smith ducks, content to weather the storm
short again, Smith leans inside the line and lets the ball fizz over his shoulder
full length and blocked back down the pitch
on the pads this time, fuller length, swinging down the leg side

outside off, good carry through to Bairstow, and a marked contrast to the carry on the first day. Will be very interesting to see how Aussie's quicks fare in the second innings, now that the pitch is livelier
blocked into the off side
full length, tapped out to midwicket for the single
another short ball, another duck (of the self-defensive variety, that is)
full length, and driven to cover
a low full toss, a freebie, and Paine slams it through the covers. Cash in when you can!
solidly onto the front foot, better areas from Moeen
fully forward, that's the length from Moeen, dragging the man down to meet the pitch
flicked hard back to the bowler
blocked on the front foot to the off side
short again, angled down the leg side, and too short for the umpires
keeps it short, floats over Smith's back
worked off his hip towards leg gully
back of a length outside off, defended on his toes towards point
touch fuller, angled in at off stump, worked into the leg side
well bowled, this takes the splice of the bat as he climbs a touch from short of a length, pops to the off side
ah, Smith wins the battle this time, Ball gets his line wrong, angled into the hip and clipped away fine for his first boundary of the day
drives a full delivery to mid-off
the bottom hand comes into play as he whips this one back to Moeen
gets forward and pushes to cover
goes back, defends
fuller, brings him onto the front foot, defended to cover
tight line outside off, he presses forward and plays to the covers. A maiden
round the wicket, pitches outside leg, whipped to midwicket
beats the man at midwicket this time with a flick
pads this away outside leg stump
slides down the leg side, Paine doesn't offer a shot
uses the bat this time, again pitches outside leg, tapped to the on side
fuller, on the stumps, flicked back to the bowler
full, he plays back, defends
again he's back in the crease to a reasonably full delivery
wider line outside off, Smith gets forward and works back to Moeen
straighter, tucked off the pads behind square
round the wicket, a little short, whipped off his pads through square leg to bring up the 200
tries to play a repeat but this time finds the man at square leg
starts on a full length outside off, hint of away swing, left alone
gets too straight this time, neatly flicked off the pads in front of square...harder ball can be easier to score off, too
back on off stump, defended to the covers

new ball strikes! A ripper from Anderson. Just back of a length at off stump, climbs a little and nips away from Paine who can only send an outside edge to Bairstow. Very neat take, one-handed, diving to his right
back of a length at off stump, defended down the pitch
good length, Starc keeping his hands soft, runs along the ground towards second slip
full, wide outside off, a strong drive and good work at point by Stoneman to cut it off with a dive...England won't mind the single
blimey! That's one way to deal with the new ball! Full from round the wicket, Starc just leans forward and bunts it clean over long-off for six
drags the length back, outside off, left alone...even Broad managed a smile after the six
what a response from Broad! Sharp grab in his follow through. Back of a length, nips in at Starc who gets a leading edge and Broad grabs it to his right
slides past the outside edge, full outside off, Cummins pressing forward
full at off stump, solidly behind it and defends to the covers
full outside off, hint of swing in at Smith, defended from the crease
extra bounce again, from a good length, Smith jerks his head back and takes the bottom hand off the bat
across the crease, defends a full delivery to the off side
wider on the crease, full at the stumps, defended to mid-on
straight and a strong whip from Smith which finds midwicket
full at middle and off, 83mph/133kph, defended to mid-on. A demanding over from Anderson
full and straight, worked to mid-on
at middle and off, he gets forward and defends
short of a length, on the back foot this time
at the stumps, good length, played with a straight bat
85mph/136kph, at middle and off, solidly behind the line...he's got a decent set-up as a batsman
a shorter delivery to end the over, just outside off, defended down towards point
pushes forward on off stump, defended
wider outside off, left alone
he's padded up to this! Big appeal for lbw, but it's too high...Root doesn't review. Significant movement back in at Smith. Lovely variation from Anderson
so skillful from Anderson, this nips back from a good length, Smith is able to leave but it's a challenging line
gets quite a way across here, working to leg, deflects off the pad to the leg side
full and straight, defended back to Anderson...just a suggestion Anderson may have niggled something
gets across to a straight ball and works into midwicket
good length at off stump, 86mph/138kph, defended
fuller, he drives but it gets cut off by cover
strides forward and drives this on the up towards Malan at cover
a shorter delivery, takes a thickish inside edge behind square on the leg side
shortish outside off, Smith tries to open the face and finds a gap but can't beat backward point
full and straight, defended
driven carefully back down the pitch
a nice-looking drive as he gets onto the front foot and finds mid-off
well bowled! Short at off stump, climbs past the bat as Cummins pulls his bat inside the line but he may have been beaten
a solid drive which Ball gets a hand on in his follow through and deflects towards mid-on
nice delivery, shapes back in at Smith who has to adjust late in his defensive shot
short outside off, fairly harmless
and again, a bit floaty through to Bairstow
fuller, angled in at off stump, defended towards backward point...Cummins looking solid
full, outside off, would be tempting to drive that but he does well to shoulder arms
full and straight, defended into that ring on the off side
full, outside off, through to the keeper to end the session
tight line, full length, defended
floaty full length, inviting the drive, and Smith latches on. A fine pouncing dive from Broad at mid-off cuts off the four
back of a length, and blocked on the line of off stump
two funky close catchers on the crease line at mildly stupid mid-on and mid-off
luring the drive, Cummins has a go, and that one hits the seam and veers back in through the gate and past the stumps!
well played, leaning forward, meeting the half-volley, and slotting a boundary through long-on
outside off, tapped to cover, Smith settles for the single
held back on a tight off-stump line. Cummins leans forward to block
that's a ripper! Significant jag off the seam, and sawing Cummins in half as it passes over the top of middle. Lively times
outside off, left alone, less deviation this time
back of a length, tight line, defended on the back foot
through to the keeper once again, an umbrella of close catchers in his eyeline as Cummins leaves alone. Drive those if you dare!
banged out on a good length
through to the keeper
hops into line outside off stump. Blocked resolutely
bashing the pitch outside off, trying to tempt the drive but nothing doing
wider on the crease, tight and full on off stump. Blocked again
firmly punched off the back foot, but straight to short cover
outside off, back of a length, no stroke offered
a crease-bound block as Woakes keeps his line and length tight to the top of off stump
well bowled, floats this one a touch fuller, and Cummins flinches in the corridor as the ball zips off the deck
bouncer, wide of off stump, Cummins ducks
well bowled again, full length, just outside off. Cummins avoids temptation
a fine leave as Cummins barely reacts to an off-stump lifter that passes through to the keeper
tapped to point, a sharp single
outside off stump, through to the keeper once more
bouncer, well directed. Cummins ducks, holding his composure well in this innings
ooh, so nearly a run-out chance, but instead it's overthrows! Cummins runs his bat in as Vince's shy came in from the covers, but the ball deflects off the bat and away to the rope
there we go, Smith's second boundary of the day, and that's superb. Too full, but slotted dead straight through mid-on
wider outside off stump, a hint of swing as Smith leaves alone
full length, outside off, no stroke offered
full length, defended into the gully
banged in short, wide of off stump. Cummins leans inside the line with no concerns
fully forward, meeting the fuller, straighter delivery with a dead bat
wheeling away on a tight line
wider on the crease, same resolute response from an obdurate tailender
looped up on leg stump, tucked to mid-on
worked into the gap at mid-on, who had just been dropped a touch deeper
forward and driven into the covers
tossed up, and driven back to Moeen, who grabs in his followthrough
shuffling feet, looking for the cut, but can't get it away
solidly onto the front foot to see out the over
wide of off stump, a crashing drive out to deep cover
defended into the off side, thoughts of a single but think better of it
smashed through the covers, that's a terrific strike, and perfectly weighted too, prompting a full-tilt sprint from Malan who can't intercept in time
outside off, another fine leave as the ball nips over the top of the stumps
forward to defend
full length, attacking middle and leg, well fended away
round the wicket, blocked firmly back down the track
tossed up, Smith whips firmly across the line, but midwicket is well placed to intercept
a touch shorter, flicked square for the single
well bowled, attacking off stump from over the wicket. Blocked
that's a confident piece of strike rotation, a big stride and a calm clip to the vacant mid-on
on the back foot, worked around the corner
there we go, banged in short, and Cummins ducks
aims for the yorker, good thinking,  but can't spear it in
on the back foot, Cummins hops into line to defend
good bouncer! Skimming over Cummins' armpit as he hauls his neck inside the line
full again, another attempted yorker, neatly flicked to midwicket
banged in short, Cummins angles his defensive block down into the leg side. Tremendous defensive batting
flicked up and over the catcher at short midwicket
tossed up outside off, Cummins leans forward to block. Good length
flatter this time, defended on the back foot outside off
too short this time, but Cummins doesn't risk throwing it away. Patted back to the bowler
forward this time, finds the gap at cover for the single
outside off, short from Moeen, and Smith fails to capitalise with a firm chop to point
a slow bouncer outside off, cut to point. 78mph that time
banged in short, tucked round the corner, but there seems to be fielders everywhere at the moment. Straight to short backward square
speared into the pads from wide on the crease
tapped into the leg side
short again, over the shoulder into Bairstow's gloves
a fine leg glance on this occasion, though a ropey delivery, on the pads, very full, picked off with glee
round the wicket, tucked off the pads, short backward square gathers
tossed up, clipped firmly past short midwicket
smashed! That shot might well hasten a change of tactics! Tossed up, wide of off stump, and Cummins slams it with open shoulders, clean over long-on
tossed up, blocked to the off side
lining up the cut, but big spin changes his mind
forward and pushed to cover
outside off stump, shaping away. Left alone
outside off, very full, no stroke offered
round the wicket, wide of off stump and swinging away. Tempting Smith to chase it if he wants to get any closer to his hundred
tighter line, from back over the wicket. Blocked to gully
round the wicket, mixing it up on a ball-by-ball basis. Left alone
and back over the wicket again. Punched to cover
bending back into the right-hander, only 78mph, but looked solid in his action
wider on the crease, defended down into the pitch
a waft outside off! Cummins lines up a slap but the ball ghosts through to the keeper. Brief excitement in the slips, but no contact
bending back into the pads
very tight to Cummins' pads, offering little or no width. 83mph, which is solid from Anderson.
wicket to wicket to finish. On that evidence, Anderson doesn't seem to be carrying any significant niggle
full outside off, left alone
wider, through to the keeper
flicked from around off stump, finds mid-on
has a flash! Almost edges to Bairstow as goes after a shortish delivery outside off, aiming square through the off side
gets across the stumps and nudges a length ball in front of square
full outside off, 79mph/127kph, leaves it alone
short of a length at off stump, defended down by his feet
nicely played, strides forward into a full delivery and places it through the covers
pulls the length back, left alone outside off
that's a good one, nibbles past the outside edge as Cummins presses forward. Just straightened off the seam
full and straight, clipped to midwicket
back of a length outside off, through to the keeper at ankle height
turns a full delivery from outside off towards mid-on for a sharpish single, Cummins has to get a hurry on and loses his bat as he crosses the crease. Might have been interesting with a direct hit
a bouncer which he ducks
another short ball, he allows this one over his back
again it's short, over off stump, Cummins has all the time in the world to sway out of the line. Reaches Bairstow at his bootlaces
gets behind the line of a short-of-a-length delivery, defends to the on side
short, wide outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, tapped to the covers
played off the back foot into the covers
fuller, outside off, left alone
gets right across the crease and defends
a shorter delivery, defended off the back foot to the covers
nips back a fraction off the seam from short of a length, pushed to mid-on
neatly knocks a short ball into the leg side, smart batting
full, wide outside off, left alone
long way across, a stride forward and defends a full delivery

there it is! What an innings from the captain. Broad came round the wicket, pushed a full delivery full outside off and Smith laced it wide of mid-off with a lovely drive. He's pumped. Century No. 21. What a way to set a tone in the series
back over the wicket, skews a thickish edge as he drives and it scoots through backward point
full at off stump, defended to mid-on
now it's Cummins turn to drive, reaches out to a wide delivery, opens the face a touch and sends it through backward point
pulls the length back, Cummins brings his bat inside the line
full outside off, left alone
hangs it full outside off, left alone
onto the front foot, drives to backward point...Cummins freeing up a touch?
defended off a thick outside edge, wide of slip and gully can't cut off the single
full at off stump, drives into his boot and the ball runs to cover
left alone outside off
full at off stump, driven to mid-on
a princely drive from the No. 9 as he steps forward and slots into the gap between cover and mid-off
delivered from quite wide, left alone outside off
defends a good length ball to the off side
full outside off, left alone
forward, blocks a full ball to the covers
full and straight, clipped firmly to midwicket
defended on the back foot
back of a length, Smith opens the face a touch as he plays to cover
full outside off, he's not interested
short outside off, he drops his hands and allows it through
defended into midwicket and they trot through for the single
wide outside off, he's left plenty of those alone in this epic innings...England looking a little flat at the moment
a length ball angled in at off stump, defended
left alone outside off
leans back a touch as he drives square into the off side
controls this well, gets over a cut shot but can't beat backward point
fuller, that may have been a cutter, was 73mph/117kph, played off the front foot
sways out of the line of a short ball which wasn't much of a threat
a strangled appeal as this skims past the outside edge, Root is the most interested, fielding at cover, but Bairstow and Cook behind the wicket are less sure
full on leg stump, clipped off the pads to deep square
full outside off, left alone
back of a length from wide on the crease, gun-barrel straight, defended to the leg side
beats the edge this time as Cummins drives at a full delivery
back of a length on off stump, defended
fuller, 84mph/135kph, bunted back to the bowler
on off stump, back of a length, nowt off the seam for him, played back down the pitch

he's done it! Cummins finally snaps. Woakes pitches it up outside off, draws the drive and Cook takes a very good catch, low to his right at the lone slip. He's left so well, but couldn't resist the drive this time. How England needed that
length outside off, jabbed to the covers...will Smith change gears now or trust his No. 10?
throws his hands through this one, poor ball, short outside off, slashes it strongly behind point
back on off stump, short of a length, defended to midwicket
full on the pads, clipped off the toes to deep square leg
well bowled, pushed across the left hander and it slides past the outside edge
goes full and straight, nicely off the middle of the bat as he clips it through square leg and Smith is alert to call him back for the second
good bouncer! Not far from giving Smith a blow as he he ducks...didn't quite get up as he expected
short, wide outside off, left alone
that's brilliantly played, leans back and upper cuts a short ball over backward point down to third man
and this time he pulls the short ball, it was more at the body, gets it quickly to ground...sharp work at deep square to keep them to a single
round the wicket, short of a length, comfortably defended on the back foot
fuller, at off stump, kept out to the off side
walloped out through the leg side to bring Hazlewood onto strike
tossed up, and dug out on the creaseline from round the wicket
good areas, lobbed onto a good length, and blocked
defended into the off side
a crashing drive, but Alastair Cook at short extra cover pounces well
very full and tight, Hazlewood blocks
a pop from a good length, as Smith withdraws his bottom hand in a bit of surprise
angled into the legs, straightens a touch from back of a length
full and straight, blocked in front of off stump
crunched off the back foot as Broad strays a touch short and wide. Third man rushes round to gather
through to the keeper
back of a length, punched out to the off side
round the wicket, looped onto a good length. Blocked, as a knot of close fielders lurk
solidly forward, defended once again
angled into the off side
good areas, Mo
solidly forward, hitting that good length once again
worked to leg once more
full and straight. Smith smacks hard through the line, but mid-on swoops round to gather
on the pads, another welcome tuck to leg for Smith who rushes through for the single
nudged to leg from round the wicket, working with the angle
full again, driven off an inside edge, to short midwicket
cracked hard through the covers. Just straying a touch from the straight and narrow. And the deficit is single figures
over the wicket, Broad rolls his fingers on this one as Smith pokes to the off side
up on the toes, cracked hard to Stoneman under the lid at silly mid-off
nudged to leg
outside off, and smacked through the off side
fully forward and poked to the off side
forward, head over the ball, Hazlewood filling the Cummins role well
turn and bounce, and beats the edge. Lots of daylight, but a reminder of how much life there is for the spinners
very full, and cracked out to the covers. Smith looking to free his arms a touch more now with the rabbits out of the hutch
good bouncer! Smith does the full limbo as the ball skims over his chest
forward, into the covers
worked off the hip into the leg side
full again, not quite the yorker, Smith clears the front leg, but can't beat short cover with an expansive tonk
on the legs, Smith keeps the strike, Australia trail by 5...
that was an utter pie from Moeen, a genuine long hop, but Stoneman under the lid is perfectly placed to intercept with his knees. That would have hurt but for the padding
too short again, pumped into the off side this time
leaning forward, blocked to the off side
bowled him! Probably over-pitched to be honest, but it was straight, and that's what mattered. Hazlewood was lured into a swish across the line, and back goes the middle stump!
pushed onto the back foot with a hint of turn, defended
blocked into the off side to see out the over
sliding down the leg side. Smith misses out
better line from Broad, inviting Smith to take a single into the covers, but he declines with only Lyon for company
on the pads, whipped round the corner, and this time he does take the single
outside off, full length, that's a tidy leave
driven with compact elegance down to mid-off. Nice Garry!
a bit of extra nip as Broad serves up the legcutter. Poked into the off side off the splice
banged in short, Smith barely flinches as the ball hops over his shoulder
short again, Smith aims for a forearm smash, but can't reach it. He's a bit miffed that that wasn't called wide
on the legs, whipped up and over the leg side and Australia take the lead!
clipped to leg once again, swivelling into his strokeplay
wide of off stump, short as well. Lyon barely breaks out of his stance
tucked to the leg side, an easy single, but Smith wants to keep the strike. Poor Garry remains on 0
onto the front foot, crunched to mid-on
battered into the covers, very full length, but hits Root at extra cover. England have placed their fields superbly in this innings
tremendous crunching square drive, and Stoneman does a fine job of intercepting at deep cover
outside off, gathered at short third man. Smith is boshing it, but keeps hitting the field
short and Smith attempts the limbo-glance, but doesn't connect. He's cross with himself
Smith premeditates a move across his stumps, so Woakes fires it down the leg side. Cunning. A dot. Lyon will be on strike
wicket to wicket, blocked in front of off
on the toes, that's a fine flick out to deep midwicket. They pick up three, and get Smith back on strike. Top nurdling Garry
flicked to fine leg
worked to the leg side once again
straight-batted defence, back down the track
tremendous batting! Barely even over-pitched, but Smith shuffled into line, flicked perfectly straight and picked off a beautiful four straight down the ground
back of a length, defended back down the pitch
solidly forward, and pushed into the covers
short, and swivel-pulled backward of square! Shot Garry! Just leaned inside the line and picked off a valuable boundary
defended down the track
fuller length, worked to the leg side
attempted yorker, but watchfully negotiated
flicked from outside leg, Smith takes the single straight up
forward and blocked into the covers
punched back up the pitch
worked off the hip
down the leg side, helped on its way. England are losing their discipline a touch as this stand extends
big stride forward and blocked to the off side
inside-edge onto the pad-flap... Woakes was halfway up for an lbw appeal there
cracked to point, lots of energy in the stroke
a big cutter, leaps back into the right-hander. Well bowled
spanked! Just a touch too short and battered through the leg side. This has been a formidable performance
stand and deliver, no footwork, just perfect hand-eye coordination to drill it into the covers
Lyon survives with ease
worked off the pads, lots of leg-side freebies sneaking in now
defended
tucked off the face of the bat, and that is pocketed at leg slip! Just trying to work it around the corner and couldn't keep it down. Neat catch
and there's an appeal! But it's a false alarm. Slides down the leg side, Cook looks to flick it away. You can feel the excitement
short, wide outside off, left alone
full at off stump, 88mph/143kph, defended with a straight bat
good line and length, full at off stump, 89mph, defended
touch fuller, Cook makes himself get forward and pushes to mid-on
short of a length, touches 90mph/145kph, defended with an open face towards point
off the mark with a boundary, but wasn't too far from backward point...short outside off, slashed away with a cut shot
tighter to off stump, short of a length, left alone
perhaps a touch short, carries at waist height through to Paine
fuller, brings him forward, defended
keeps it just back of a length, certainly getting some nice carry
defended on the front foot...a range-finding first over
short of a length at off stump, gets inside the line and clips to square leg
finds the gap this time with a nudge off the hip wide of the man at square leg
well bowled, Cook reaches out a little but manages to get the edge quickly to ground wide of third slip
banged in short at off stump, gets on top of the bounce and finds a gap at cover
flash and a miss, dropped in short, Stoneman tries to play off the back foot and is close to nicking it
very wide outside off, left alone
over the wicket, short of a length at off stump, probably wants to get a little fuller
there we go, pushes this up fuller outside off, left alone

hooked to long leg! Oh boy, what has Cook done there?! Maybe he doesn't want to go full. A well-directed short ball, over middle and leg, Cook can't get over the ball was he hooks, it's a big top edge and superbly held on the boundary by Starc. Ran around and got down low to grab it. A poor match for the former captain
good length outside off, left alone, plenty of noise from the Australians...they sense a huge moment in the match
another bouncer, angled over leg stump, Vince ducks
nicely off the mark, slipped onto the pads and it's clipped through square
good shot! Went full and straight, overpitched, and sweetly clipped through square leg
drags the length back, outside off, left alone
that's a gem! Just short of a length, beats Stoneman's outside edge...didn't do much, just enough off the seam
short of a length, straight, worked to the leg side
defends a back-of-a-length delivery to mid-on
that's loose! Reaches out for a full, wide delivery, miles away from his body and is lucky not to edge that behind
think he pulled his bat inside the line at the last moment
edged! But just short of third slip...plenty happening. Full at off stump, Vince gets forward but doesn't push too hard
gone now! Back of a length on off stump, climbs at Vince, takes the edge which flies to second slip. That's a beauty, not much Vince could do about that. A proper Gabba dismissal
right on the spot, full just outside off, defended to cover
pushes up at the stumps, hint of shape, defended to mid-on
good length at off stump, Root solidly behind the line as the Gabba finds its voice
short on the hip, clipped down to long leg
pushed across outside off, left alone
fuller, at off stump, 89mph/143kph, Root plays off the front foot to mid-off

smashes into the helmet! The earpiece has broken off. The Aussies are straight up to Root to make sure he's okay. A short ball at the perfect height, Root couldn't duck underneath. Takes him on the grille and into the corner of the peak
it's another short one, this time he's able to get underneath...88mph/141kph
short of a length, pushed across outside off, left alone
angled across outside off, back of a length, rises past the bat although Stoneman just about inside the line
fuller, at off stump, defended to mid-off
back of a length, angled across, left alone
that's a short one that didn't come out quite right, 81mph/130kph, Hazlewood has a quick look at the take-off area
comes round the wicket, full outside off, driven confidently through the off side
driven to mid-on
short of a length, climbs through to the keeper
this bouncer is outside stump
short of a length, at off stump, Root hops into line and defends towards mid-off
pushes this up fuller, left alone
short on leg stump, Root goes for the pull and cloths it somewhat down to long leg
jumps inside the line of a short delivery on leg stump and clips to long leg
short of a length at off stump, defended at the top of the bounce
on the pads, clipped to long leg
across to off stump and defends a length ball
full outside off, driven on the front foot to cover
a hint of shape in on a full length, driven to mid-off
on off stump, defended
short of a length outside off, pulls his bat well inside the line
fuller, outside off, puts his front foot forward then leaves alone
full and driven to mid-off
a short ball across the chest as Stoneman arches out of the line
well played, good short ball, at the body, he keeps it down in front of Marsh
full, nice carry outside off, Paine has to jump a little to gather it
round the wicket, and there's turn...was a touch short, Root played off the back foot
short outside leg stump, pulled to deep backward square...scores are level
round the wicket, on off stump, worked to short leg
this turns from a shortish length, time for Stoneman to see it
fuller, brings him forward, defended
straighter delivery and a nicely-timed punched through midwicket to take England into the lead
short, wide outside leg, through to the keeper
he didn't know much about that! A well-directed short ball at the body, Stoneman tries to stand and play it, the ball looms off the shoulder of the bat or glove and loops towards the slips
short of a length, back behind the line, defended
vicious! A short ball at the throat, Stoneman jumping in the crease, thrusts his gloves at the ball and it flies away from the catchers
this one is too short, over his back
takes one on the body, actually well played, short of a length, Stoneman allows it to hit him as he drops his gloves...blimey, this is tense
plays back deep in the crease, flicked off the pads to deep square
pushed off the back foot to the covers
what a beauty! Gets it much fuller, on the off stump, and it rips past Stoneman's outside edge
dragged down short but he cuts it straight to point
and now he leaves the arm ball! Great bowling, not far at all from the off stump
pushed into the pads, deflects to short leg...a different challenge to the pace of Cummins but another examination of technique
short of a length at off stump, takes his bottom hand off the bat to keep the ball down
very short, too wide, Root will be happy for that and this time of the day
good batting (although Stoneman may not agree) as he knocks a length ball into the off side
short of a length on off stump, defended on the back foot
a bouncer, he ducks
well played, solidly on the back foot and defends past silly point
round the wicket, defended on the back foot
a fraction short on off stump, pushed to point
gets it fuller, Root is forward and defends
flicked off the pads into square leg and it's over to Stoneman
finds the edge, but it goes to ground wide of the second slip...so it's Root to face the final ball
a rare poor one to end with, spins down the leg side and he can leave it alone
tight line and length, good leave outside off
on the hip and comfortably tapped into the gap to re-open Stoneman's account
nurdled down through third man, a productive area for the skipper
flipped into the leg side, another one of his trademark stealth singles
outside off, a hint of outswing to the left-hander, left well alone
another good leave from Stoneman. He has looked a very well organised unit in this Test, and tour
very full, attacking Root's off stump from over the wicket, squirted into the gully
full again, hitting the popping crease wide of off stump, Root attempts a glide through the cordon
shot from Root! Wide again from Starc, but a half-volley length and punched forcefully through the covers with sublime balance
compact drive, back down the pitch, Starc sticks out a left hand to intercept
back of a length, Root stands tall on the back foot to defend
down the leg side, hauled around the corner and Hazlewood is on hand to cut off the four. This has been solid and, dare one say it, comfortable so far for England. All 12 balls of it...
tight wicket-to-wicket line. Blocked back down the track
a hint of shape back into the right-hander as Root defends again. A more threatening line
leaning onto the front foot, and blocked to the off side
stabbed to the off side
banged in short, and Root climbs into that one, rising to the top of the bounce, hitting down hard with the cut, and forcing it through third man. Well played
inswinger on the leg stump, that's easy pickings for Root in this sort of a mood. Very bubbly start to his day's work
over the wicket, on the pads, tucked to the leg side
back of a length, tailing back into Root, who squares up on the back foot and blocks into the leg side for a sharp stolen single
back of a length, outside off, no need to play at that one
down the leg side, banged in short but misdirected
better channel, outside off, tempting the drive but Stoneman won't be drawn
outside off, and through to the keeper
outside off, no stroke offered
tight line from Hazlewood, but good judgement from Root
a touch fuller, on the pads, worked to mid-on
outside off, a leading edge as Hazlewood finds a bit of late nibble to square Root up. Safe enough in the end
cracked hard off the back foot but excellently intercepted by Marsh at point
big stride, left alone
outside off, dabbed into the gully off the back foot
clipped firmly up through mid-on, well played and placed
outside off, pushed hard off the back foot
banged in down the leg side. Nothing doing there
good lift off the deck outside Stoneman's off stump, but no temptation to have a slash at it
outside off, tighter line, Stoneman hops into a solid back-foot block
solid line and length
patted into the off side, watchfully played off the back foot
fuller length, bending a touch into the right hander. Blocked
back foot again, calmly punched into the gap at cover
drops the hands as Cummins bangs one past where his splice would have been. Well played
up on the toes, jabbed to leg, runs are leaking a bit this morning from the Aussies
round the wicket, good length immediately from Lyon as Stoneman leans forward to block on off stump
a big leave outside off as Lyon finds a hint of turn and bounce
looped onto middle and leg, blocked
this one slips a touch straighter, as Stoneman slides back across his crease to defend
poked into the leg side with lots of gasps around the bat
back of a length, Stoneman chops hard through backward point but can't beat the field. Good selective hitting though
forward and punched to cover
up on the toes, defended to the leg side
crunched into the covers, good solid contact
chiselled off the legs, out to midwicket for another cheeky single.
Stoneman is dragged into a loose punch but gets away with it! Outside off, much wider, Stoneman drives off the back foot, feet not moving, and gully is momentarily in business. Lucky...
through to the keeper this time, as Stoneman hauls his bat inside the line
down the leg side
on the back foot, worked to the leg side. Three close catchers in attendance
clipped urgently off middle and leg, pushing for two but settling for the single
fully forward, and blocked back down the pitch
big stride, Stoneman wanted to flog that through the covers, but thought better of it
pushed onto the back foot once again
through to the keeper
Root is lured into the hook as Cummins pings down a bouncer. No contact, as Root rehearses the shot after it has flown by
flipped square as Cummins strays onto the pads
short and sharpish. Didn't get up much as Stoneman leant back inside the line
banged in short, Stoneman raises his gloves out of harm's way and wears one on the torso. He's hard
stabbed through the covers for another simple single
well flighted, defended on the crease
stretching forward and pushed to the cover ring. 'Beautiful Garry!' is the cry!

got him! The overspin does the trick as Stoneman is suckered by the one that slides a touch straighter. Grazes the edge and scooped low at slip! Beautiful indeed from the Goat. Extra oats for him tonight!
a touch wider as Malan has a slap out to point, nice to feel bat on ball
a big yawning leave outside off to end a successful over
banged in short
up on the toes, and punched to cover
outside off, and through to the keeper
on the back foot, and punched to the off side
edged but short of slip! Wider of the crease, and Root admonishes himself, no need to play at that, but he was suckered by the angle. Still, he lives to fight on
short and sharp, down the leg side and Root has a swing. No contact, but for the first time this morning, England's captain looks a touch less composed
outside off, sharp spin, left alone
fully forward and defended to the off side
good intent from Malan! Advancing out of the crease to meet the pitch and drive, very calmly, to mid-off. Off the mark in confident fashion
Root follows Malan's lead, advancing to the pitch as Lyon slides down the leg side, and chisels a single to midwicket
on the back foot, Malan squares up in defence
left alone, good areas from Lyon, and sharp spin too
good length outside off, defended with an open face to point
left alone outside off
excitement from Cummins as Root plays across a straight delivery, gets a thick inside edge into the pad which then runs into square leg. Appears to move okay
that zips through outside off, Paine takes it on the rise
short on leg stump, pulled with good control to deep square leg
gets forward into a good-length ball, runs into midwicket
worked off the pads into square leg
that's a good 'un! Squares up Malan on off stump, spins past the outside edge as he plays back
fuller, he leans forward and defends
shorter, he rocks back and cuts into point but can't take full advantage
dragged down a touch short and pushed leg side, Root pulls behind square
nice line and length, at off stump, defended
short outside off, Root picks out point as he cuts
gets on a fuller length, angled across, left alone
short again, Root slashes a back-cut and it goes straight to gully
on leg stump, he shuffles back and clips off the pads down to long leg
round the wicket, well played, short at leg stump, knocked around the corner to long leg
pulls a short delivery to long leg
spins into the pads, tucked behind square
short of a length on off stump, played off the back foot to the covers
left alone outside off
he's done it again! What lovely bowling. Gets his line slightly straighter, on middle, Malan has to play, it spins and takes the edge. A simple catch for Smith at slip
beaten! Another crackerjack. Just outside off this time, grips past the outside edge as Moeen comes forward
jeepers, spin and bounce! Although Moeen may have just pulled the bat inside the line. Sharp take by Paine
short of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot
cuts in front of square without much timing

has this carried?! Not quite. A short ball at off stump, Moeen in two minds how to play it, tries to drop his hands and it takes the glove. Smith knew it wouldn't reach first slip, tries to dive across but can't quite get to it
short again, flicked in the air off his body but wide of short leg
not far from spooning a catch to the bowler, it's short outside off and Root is through a half-hearted pull. Takes the toe end back down the pitch
short again, on leg stump, pulls it very fine past Paine and beats fine leg
full at off stump, defended on the front foot
touch short and that's nicely timed off the back foot between the two men in the covers
nice line, on off stump, hint of turn, defended down off the inside half of the bat
plays back to a slightly shorter delivery and turns it to short leg
uses his feet, comes down outside off, flicks into midwicket
tossed wider outside off, Root thrusts forward and defends
ducks under a short ball
short, down the leg side, Moeen sways inside the line
another bouncer, a touch straighter, Moeen doesn't have to do too much to avoid it
that's better, gets over off stump with this bouncer, touch quicker as well, Moeen drops his hands and bends his knees
keeps it short, over leg stump this time, Starc shares some advice with Moeen
back of a length, he gets inside the line and works off his hip behind square. Lyon won't mind that, means he has Moeen to bowl to
full at middle, flicked into midwicket
brings out the sweep, was taken from around off stump, deep square gets around
comes forward and defends
fuller, blocked back to the bowler
pushes forward quite firmly and finds cover
that's short and wide, Moeen takes full advantage this time as he leans back and cuts in front of square
full outside off, left alone
touch of width outside off, Root places this perfectly between the two men in the point area with a horizontal bat
fuller, at off stump, pushed to mid-on
nicely forward and drives to wide mid-off
strong drive from the captain, this is full and tails into off stump, Root slots it straight down the ground and even Warner can't chase it down...although it was a fine effort
pulls the length back, defended on the back foot to cover...first hint of reverse swing?
a rare poor ball, full and down the leg side, Moeen tickles it neatly to fine leg
back on a good line and length, at middle and off, defended
brings out the slog sweep to a very full delivery, takes more bottom edge than middle to deep square
uses his feet and flicks towards deep mid-on who is about two-thirds of the way back to the fence
slides on outside off, nice bounce, left alone
fuller at the stumps, flicked wide of short leg
deep in the crease and tucks this to backward square
good length at off stump, defended to cover
a touch fuller, pushed with a slightly open face towards point
nicely done, just leans forward into a full delivery on off stump and eases it straight of mid-off
the response is a short ball, Moeen gets over the top, rolls his wrists to keep the ball down and finds deep square
angled into the pads, clipped through midwicket and that's his fifty...about a third of what England need from him

he won't go further than fifty! Full, straight, nips back off the seam, and given by Aleem Dar. Root ponders for an age then decides against the review. Almost a carbon copy of the first innings. Resume those conversion-rate debates. Is that the decisive blow of this Test. Replay shows it was three reds
big spin outside off, left alone
leans forward and defends
shorter, pushed off the back foot and Lyon gets across
dragged down short and Moeen wallops it through midwicket as he skips back and pulls
back on a full length, defended
this rags past the outside edge although was short enough for Moeen to play inside the line
back of a length outside off, defended to cover
worked off the pad into midwicket
well left, angled across on off stump
another nice drive from Moeen as he leans forward, but this time Warner gets across from mid-off
back of a length outside off, cut into the ground and it bounces to gully
a bouncer outside off, Bairstow sways out of the line...and that proves the last ball of the session
good line, sharp turn, left alone
that's a ripper! Flight, dip, huge rip past the left-hander's edge.
there we go! No messing around from Moeen! Down the track, a big lofted haymaker down the ground, in the air but he don't care, wide of long-on and into the rope
tucked into the leg side
a firm sweep, and that's glorious. Down on one knee and panned through square leg. Balance, reach, nailed it
outside off and left alone again
solid block back down the line of the ball
on the legs, 'wait on!' is the cry as Bairstow flicks to midwicket
another attempted flick to leg, very full length
width, and Bairstow climbs into that one. Head over the ball, hands through the line, cracked through point
bouncer. Bairstow ducks as the ball sails over his shoulder
on the pads, and that was travelling quickly to Hazlewood at fine leg. Well intercepted in the end
outside off, no stroke offered
good areas again from Lyon, left alone
big stride forward to smother the spin
defended on the back foot this time. Blocked to the off side
half forward, and short leg would have been in business there, but short leg has been moved to a defensive position!
forward and pushed down the track
on the back foot, defended to the leg side
driven hard to mid-off, that made a sweet sound off the bat
short and through to the keeper
'wait on' is the cry again as Bairstow bashes to mid-off
defend-driven to cover
stands tall in defence, on the back foot, blocked again
puhsed back down the pitch
aggressively driven into the covers, capitalising on a slightly short ball, but failing to beat the field
worked off the hip to midwicket
round the wicket to the right-hander. Stabbed back down the track

thumped through the covers and all the way to the rope! A touch of width, but had to be mindful of the spin. A checked stroke, right on top of the spin. Cummins wrecks his sunglasses as he demolishes the rope with his knee
forward and blocked, tighter line and a bit more air from Lyon
not yet though. Full length outside off, and driven to cover
on the hips, whipped to deep square leg
on the back foot, defended under the eyeline
outside off, and punched through the covers
pushed onto the front foot, a slower ball from Cummins
on the pads, worked behind square. England are ticking nicely in this session. No panic stations for Australia by any means. But they need a wicket... or at least to chalk up some maidens
an aggressive flog through point
onto the front foot, looking to be forceful through the covers
back of a length, Moeen hops into line and sneaks the single to leg
defended once again
using the feet, slotted handsomely up and over midwicket! Tremendous strike from Bairstow, and he's forced the man back to the rope with that shot
there we go, instantly nudging the single through the vacant midwicket. England are rallying with intent at the moment
short and sharp, Bairstow ducks
outside off, defended on the back foot, down into the crease
on the legs, whipped square, the 150 is up
on the pads, flicked firmly to square leg. Another single
blocked firmly on the back foot. 89mph from Cummins, which is fairly brisk at this stage of the innings in a four-man attack
outside off, good channel from Cummins, deflected into the gully
worked off the back foot to midwicket
sliding back into the crease to defend
a beauty! Tossed up, dips late, big spin, bites past the edge. Moeen survives
a touch shorter this time, and Moeen's dancing feet make a single to midwicket. Excellent batting
on the legs, tucked to deep square leg. Runs are flowing for England
another over seen off
driven to cover
a bit of late inswing on offer there, is that a bit of reverse? Well met with a straight bat all the same
full length, pushed to the off side. More drift into the stumps
driven hard, and straight, but straight into the non-striker's stumps
a false stroke from Bairstow! This one nipped the other way off the seam, and Bairstow was lured into a flat-footed stab. A momentary lapse of concentration
better from Bairstow, wider line, slashed through point, and he is lightning between the wickets, rushing back for the second
solidly onto the front foot and pushed to cover

massive turn, and Paine whips off the bails! This one is going upstairs for the stumping...Moeen's toe is on the line, but is there anything behind it? I don't think there is. ... this is a big call. The stump cam implies there might be a millimetre in it, but I think there'll be a riot if this isn't given. The decision is OUT!
round the wicket, bat and pad together to defend
down the track, spanked back at the bowler, and had Lyon gathered cleanly that would have been a chance to ping down the stumps!
pushed across the right-hander, this one doesn't turn and beats a tentative prod
stretching forward and blocked. Goodness me, this is a tense contest
forward and pushed into the off side
driven compactly to mid-off
short and sharp, but Bairstow ducks
a bit of shape back into the right-hander as Bairstow drives again
worked off the legs to square leg
outside off, and left alone
up on the toes and driven to cover
flicked into short leg's midriff and out again! One of those ones that has to stick, but it was there for a moment
big stride forward and blocked down the pitch
flicked off the pads, round the corner, Woakes escapes his pair
down the pitch. Pushed to the off side
using the feet nicely, England still brawling in spite of everything
beaten outside off! Good delivery, just exploding off the pitch
down the leg side, a fine stretching take from Paine, who is right in the game at the moment
forward and pushed to mid-off
down the leg side once again as Paine earns his corn once more
wide of off stump, no stroke offered
short and sharp, and punched down into the crease. Well played in the end
advancing to meet the spin, excitement as the ball deflects. This is brewing nicely
dancing at the crease, working to leg
forward and punched back to the bowler
down the leg side, no stroke offered
big stride forward, but that was adjacent! Any point in a review? Nope, not this time
on the back foot, strikes the pad but down the leg side
back of a length outside off, defended
fuller, played from the crease
banged in short at off stump, jumps and defends down by his feet
angles back from short of a length, defended on the back foot
good shot, he goes fuller but too straight, strongly clipped off the pads through midwicket
good length at off stump, defended
this straightens from round the wicket, Bairstow plays back is taken high on the pads
fuller, leans forward to block
pushed wider outside off, driven into the big gap at cover that has been left as the temptation
tapped towards short leg. 'We are on here, boys,' comes the cry
forward and defends
shorter outside off, he goes back and tries to find the off-side gap by opening the face
good length outside off, slashed away behind square and well stopped by Khawaja at a wide gully
back of a length, angled into the pad, clipped towards square leg
short of a length at off stump, defended
nudges a short ball towards the catching midwicket
outside off, back of a length, pushed to the covers
goes for the pull, short-of-a-length outside off, and plays over the top of it
driven to mid-off
touch shorter outside off, he goes back in the crease and cuts to deep point
in and out of short leg?! Whipped off the back foot towards Bancroft. Ah, didn't carry
pushed to deep mid-on
rolls his wrists and flicks off the pads behind square on the leg side
over the wicket, touch too straight, worked past short leg
pushed across wide outside off, left alone
straighter, full at off stump, defended to mid-off
sprayed wide outside off, through to the keeper
a short ball angled across, Woakes drops his hands
in the channel, left alone
can't quite get the radar right, pushed short down the leg side...Woakes has a swish at it
full outside off, driven from near the bottom of the bat to cover
short outside off, cut to deep point
gets this full at middle, tapped to the leg side...bit of drift
nice flight, full at off stump, defended to the covers
touch shorter, defended on the back foot
fuller at off stump, driven past a diving Smith and mid-off is halfway back
full and straight, opens the face to drive to mid-off again
full outside off, driven to cover
back of a length outside off, pushed through the covers and it's placed perfectly to mean deep point can't stop the second. Good running
very short outside off, Bairstow isn't interested
a bouncer over leg stump, 87mph/140kph, he ducks underneath
short of a length at off stump, defended on the back foot to cover
nearly edges to Paine! Short over off stump, Bairstow aims to ramp it over the slips, then gets some advice from Starc
full at middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
driven with an open face to cover
shorter, he goes back and plays with soft hands
nicely bowled, full at off stump, encouraging the drive from Woakes
slips onto the pads and that's a neat tickle around the corner towards fine leg...the lead reaches 150
there's a drag down, only costs a single to deep midwicket
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended to cover...is that a grimace from Starc? Seemed to pull up quite quickly
short of a length, defended on the back foot
very wide outside off, not coming out quite right, Woakes square cuts it behind point
short, outside off, onto his toes and pushes into the covers...Warner hurls at the stumps
that's got some venom! Short of a length, hammers into Bairstow as he hurried trying to play to the leg side
drops his hands and lets this short one pass by off stump
defended on the front foot
very full outside off, driven to deep cover
takes a thick inside edge as he plays forward, runs behind square
shorter, pushed off the back foot to mid-on
good spot, full at off stump, hint of turn, defended to cover
defended on the back foot
stays round the wicket, short of a length, shoveled into the leg side

he's done it! Put those concerns about Starc to one side. Change of line does the trick. It's a well-directed short ball at off stump, Woakes can't keep it down as it takes the shoulder of the bat and flies low to second slip
goes for the yorker! Not far off, there's some late shape in, Broad does well to keep it out and actually work it behind square for a run. Big smiles from Starc and Broad
short of a length outside off, stands tall and punches through the covers...happy to take the third
round the wicket, short of a length at off stump, well played as he gets behind the line and defends towards cover, alert to spot the chance of the single
more good timing through the off side he gets on his toes and places a short ball through the covers...bonus for England that he keeps the strike
round the wicket, defended on the back foot
short outside off, can't quite get the place as he square drives...good work by point. Means Broad is on strike
pushed down the leg side, sharp one-handed take by Paine
full at off stump, gets well forward
nice flight, draws him forward, pushed to short cover
defended towards cover, so he sees out that over

oh dear, oh dear! Bairstow has fallen for the trap at third man. The man had just been brought in, did Bairstow not see him? Couldn't have guided it down his throat any better. Was short outside off, he ramped it over the slips and it was a simple catch
almost to third man again! Over the wicket, well-directed short ball, fended over the slips but lands short of the man who was in a little closer, almost at fly slip
round the wicket, short on off stump, hops back deep in the crease and defends towards gully
gets right across inside the line of this short ball, misses his flick and it carries over middle stump

goes for the full one, Paine is up for the catch! Smith has called the review. Starc didn't appeal. Full outside off, Broad jabs the bat down. Think there's a Hot Spot on this! A white speck as the ball passes the bat. Paine was spot on. He's had a super session.
banged in short, behind the line and takes his bottom hand off the bat to keep it down. Starc has found his mojo
round the wicket, short outside leg stump, flies over the shoulder
and another, Ball not entirely convincing as he jerks out of the line
three in a row, skims over his back
and that's that! A vicious short ball to end things. Ball can't get out of the line, fends it high in the air off the face of the bat and it loops all the way to fly slip
outside off, decent pace and swing. Looks fit enough from one ball...
stabbed into the gully from back of a length
snorter. That's the spot for Anderson. Tight to off stump, nipping away, climbing past the end
wider line, left alone
outswing again, but too wide to lure a stroke
well bowled again, bending past the edge, although Bancroft's exaggerated leave may have over-egged it. But definite signs of life with the new ball
good line, a touch of nip away from the left-hander, Warner taps to cover and scampers off the mark
fully forward and poked into the off side
excellent sharp running from Warner. Pushed back onto the stumps by a full attacking length, but finding the gap in the covers
left alone outside off stump, and through to the keeper

attacking the stumps on the angle, but that's neatly clipped by Bancroft, behind square where Ball takes a tumble at fine leg in attempting the intercept. Got to be careful on this sandy outfield... We all remember Simon Jones...
poked to the off side
back of a length, Warner punches hard in defence off the back foot
on the pads, and worked round the corner
attacking angle into the right-hander, Bancroft plays it late, right under the eyes. Good defence
full and straight, blocked back down the pitch
ripper from Anderson! Bursting past the edge with a hint of movement off the seam. Bancroft is drawn into the pitch
through to the keeper with good carry on a tight off stump line
stretching forward, tapped into the off side
round the wicket, punched down the ground
that's a ripper! Angled back into the left-hander, kept coming in all the time, and Warner had to cover his stumps but managed not to get the nick
defended into the off side
round the wicket again, clipped to the leg side
driven back to the bowler
defended from a good length
tucked to the leg side
on the back foot, nudged to the leg side
angled down through third man, overpitched from Anderson but nothing wrong with the line. A touch streaky but in control in the end
full length from Anderson, Bancroft defends, Anderson gathers, shies, and smacks Bancroft in the groin! He takes it like a man as Jimmy holds his hand up to apologise
tight line once again
inside edge as Broad finds that attacking full length from round the wicket. Aggressive bowling
a fraction too short and wide, stabbed comfortably into the gap at cover
crunched into the covers
forward and tapped out to backward point
full and straight, solid defence back down the line of the ball
outside off stump, left alone
pushed out to the off side
full length and defended into the off side
inswinger. Good thinking from Anderson but it's sliding over leg stump by the time it strikes the pad
big appeal this time from Anderson! A big inswinger again, but it does look too high, and England decline the review
outside off, cracked to point
outside the off stump, no stroke offered
round the wicket, blocked to the off side
on the pads, worked into the leg side
beaten outside off once again, very tight lines
keeps a touch low on an off-stump line. Defended
poked to the off side
well bowled again, but no rattling Bancroft's resolve
wider line, flogged into the covers, but well grabbed
on the back foot, and defended
forward, and punched into the covers. Excellent pounce by Malan to intercept
angled into the pads, blocked into the off side. Solid in defence
back of a length, defended again
tip and run, into the off side. England have bowled tight, but without penetration.
through to the keeper with a hint of away movement
tapped to cover, on the back foot, but looking for the single the moment the ball was hit
defended once more
banged in short, way over the shoulder as Warner ducked
sliding onto the pads, a big appeal from Broad as he rolls out the slower ball. But angling down
tip and run again. The running between the wickets has been especially sharp in this innings
tapped to leg for another single
on the pads, tucked back to the bowler
clipped into the leg side
nudged off the pads
a scampered single to midwicket. Moeen unable to exert much pressure so far
forward and blocked
outside off, good line and length, left alone
attacking the stumps this time, solidly defended
outside off and through to the keeper
ooh... that's tight to the edge! The slips are definitely interested, but Woakes wasn't so sure... think that was bat on pad, not ball. But good areas, Woakesy...
wide on the crease, tapped to the leg side
on the back foot, punched on the up to mid-on
sliding into the pads, as Warner goes back to defend
head over the ball, solid block
clipped to the leg side
big stride, pushed back down the pitch
a bit of indecision from Bancroft, as he starts to advance then changes his mind as he's doing so. Blocked in the end
that's more like it! Advances again, as if he'd just been practising his lengths the previous ball. And spanked handsomely over long-off!
on the back foot, and blocked
clipped off the pads, and Warner finds the gap at square leg
full length, angled across the left-hander, and guided through third man. Totally deliberate, opens the face and nails it
outside off, and worked to deep point
defended into the off side
outside off, through to the keeper
round the wicket, chiselled into the leg side
a bit of a flat-footed drive, inside-edged down the track
slower through the air, a hint of turn but nothing prodigious, compared to Lyon's bombs
battered down the ground! A couple of strides, and a roundhouse flog over long-on. There's not enough turn from Moeen to defend against such shots
this time he does rip it. Warner flings his bat and misses everything
cracked out to point. Warner starting to up the ante now
full from Woakes, flicked into the leg side
bouncer. Bancroft ducks
full again, but Bancroft is ready for the angle into the stumps, clipping firmly through midwicket
wide on the crease, through to the keeper
banged in short, Bancroft turns turtle
another bouncer, good energy from England. But their cutting edge is lacking...
a slashing square drive gives more work to deep point
full at middle and off, defended
pushed firmly past silly point off the front foot
whips across the line and finds square leg
full outside off, driven past short cover
that's high and handsome, goes down on his back knee and slog-sweeps over deep midwicket
short outside off, through to the keeper
very short, Bancroft not interested
lovely shot, gets forward and punches straight of mid-on...textbook-perfect, took it from outside off
hops behind the line and works into midwicket
full at off stump, finds Broad at mid-off
short outside off, cut to deep cover
round the wicket, very full, dug out towards point
short of a length, cut firmly in front of point to the sweeper
angled down the leg side
back outside off, short of a length, left alone
gets forward then doesn't play
happy to bide his time, there's no rush for Australia
decent delivery, back of a length, takes a thick inside edge into his pads
he's gone after that! A huge swing at a length ball angled across, Warner tries to clear mid-on. Looking to finish it?
gets the boundary this time, it's short of a length, a more controlled shot as he pulls it through straight midwicket
very full outside off, driven to point
good length at off stump, defended to the covers
short of a length, turned into the leg side and finds midwicket
a length ball angled in, clipped sweetly to midwicket
full and driven back to the bowler
full, outside off, left alone
drags the length, shapes back a touch and left alone
short again outside off, comfortably through to the keeper
that shapes in nicely on a full length, bat twists slightly in his hand as he drives
short of a length at off stump, defended to point
fetch that! Short of a length outside off, a short-arm jab pull shot, it's caused him a few problems but it's fine this time as it races straight of mid-on. Was in the air, though
fuller at middle, defended
length outside off, opens the face and steers it through point
full at middle, defended to the leg side
this zings off the middle as he flicks a full ball but finds mid-on
round the wicket, nearly does Bancroft for length as he comes down the pitch and works to the leg side
turned off the face of the bat and almost carries to short leg
plays back to a shorter ball and works to square leg
flicked wide of leg slip towards fine leg...target under 100
defended off the stumps
touch more air this time, he gets forward and defends into his boot
full at off stump, punched back to the bowler
there's a short one, gentlycarries over his head
full and straight, clipped wide of midwicket
short of a length, touch of bounce, defended to point
lovely stroke, full outside off, he leans onto the front foot and drives through the covers
good length at middle and off, defended
round the wicket, pushed to midwicket
padded away down the leg side
tries to get down the pitch, not to the pitch and he pushes to midwicket
worked into the leg side
full on off stump, worked with bottom hand back to the bowler
really loopy, right up by the crease, clipped back to Root
full outside off from round the wicket, defended to cover
worked away from off stump to the leg side
full at off stump, defended to the off side...been pretty gun-barrel straight for much of this innings from the quicks
tucked out to deep square leg from off stump
angled into the pads, not out of the middle but scoots off the inside edge down to fine leg...this one did swing a touch
works a length delivery into midwicket
tempted by more air outside off and he misses his attempt to slap it through the covers
very loopy, driven to cover
lovely late touch, waits for this outside off and guides it fine of backward point
gets fuller and straighter, defended
slides on with the arm, takes an inside edge towards short fine leg
defended into the off side
short of a length, angled into the pads, clipped to long leg
full, wide outside off, Warner throws his hands through it and sends it racing through backward point...a well-composed fifty
shorter delivery, nudged into midwicket
full outside off, defended on the front foot
tucked off his hip to long leg
a short ball, dragged down, poor delivery on the hip which Warner helps around the corner down to fine leg
padded away outside leg
defended into midwicket
leans forward and clips to the leg side
slides down the leg side
full and straight, clipped through square leg...brings up the century stand in their first Test together
short outside leg, can't beat backward square
full outside off, driven to mid-off
length outside off, defended to point
defended to mid-off
touch fuller, no movement, blocked on the front foot
this one takes a thick outside edge, from back of a length, but runs along the ground to gully
full and straight, pinged to mid-on
round the wicket, full at off stump, defended
that's a decent delivery, touch of extra bounce from a full length, takes the bottom hand off the bat as he defends
push-and-run into the off side
back of a length outside off, punched to short cover
on the back foot and plays to cover
edged as he comes forward, but it's short and wide of the lone slip
inside the line and tucks out to deep square
left alone outside off
back of a length, left alone
a short ball over off stump, he drops his hands and lets it through
worked off the pads down to fine leg, too straight, and that's a maiden Test fifty...lovely moment for him
back of a length at off stump, defended
full at the stumps, defended
a lone appeal from Broad as this deflects off the pad into square leg...was missing another set
short outside off, defended on the back foot
full, wide outside off, left alone
that's a good ball, full length outside off, hint of nibble off the seam and beats the edge...doesn't carry to Bairstow
left alone outside off
oh dear! An attempted slower ball slips out as a huge full toss wide of the stumps, pitches half way to Bairstow. Sums up England's day
pulled off the hip to deep square
a very short bouncer
gets inside the line of a short-of-a-length delivery and tucks to deep square
short of a length from round the wicket, guided to gully with a horizontal bat
steers a back-of-a-length ball out to deep point
defends a straight ball back to the bowler
round the wicket, full outside off, a flowing drive finds cover
short of a length, pushed off the back foot and again finds the man at cover
nice piece of timing, gets forward and pushes between cover and mid-off...that's a well-made three, barely beat mid-off really
short of a length outside off, left alone through to Bairstow
fuller, brings him forward, defended to cover
short of a length, on the back foot and plays to the off-side ring
round the wicket, angled in from short of a length, tucked around the corner behind square
back of a length outside off, left alone
nicely onto the front foot and drives a fuller delivery to cover
left alone outside off
touch wider, through to the keeper
in the channel, he doesn't play
full and straight, pushed firmly to mid-on
pings this full delivery straight down the pitch, Broad gets his left hand down to it
full, some width outside off, driven to deep cover
back of a length outside off, left alone
full at off stump, defended with a closed face to midwicket
that's a good ball, just short of a length and moves away to beat the outside edge
very neatly played, pulls a short ball off his hip and gets it fine of the square long leg
full, wide outside off, left alone
skips inside the line and knocks a short ball to deep square
a short ball which he allows over his back
length outside off, defended to cover
skims this past the outside edge as he pushes forward at a length delivery
very full outside off, driven to deep cover
was he beaten or did he pull the bat away in time? Short of a length outside off, he was beaten
defends off the stumps towards mid-on
full and straight, a bottom-handed flick finds mid-on
gets forward and drives a full delivery just to the left of mid-off
slips down the leg side
short outside off, driven square through the covers
this swings in on a full length, squeezed off a thick inside edge down to long leg
good length outside off, left alone
touch shorter, allows it through
fuller, at off stump, defended with a straight bat
full, outside off, hint of swing in at Bancroft who defends on the front foot
is that a tickle? Short down the leg side, he goes for the pull. There was a small noise. Close to bat and glove...well, there is a spike on Snicko but seemingly after the ball had gone past the bat
short again, connects well with the pull this time to deep square
short of a length, defended
full outside off, left alone
short of a length, angled in at off stump, defended
gets across and tucks a back-of-a-length ball into midwicket
round the wicket, banged in very short, and it's called wide for height
short again, this time he goes for the pull and the ball dies under the bottom edge
